customer_review: Not Verified | San Diego to LaGuardia via Dallas. This airline always has problems. They overbook and then want people to give up seats and baggage because there is no room in the plane. When you are traveling from point A to point B and then C it’s not okay. They are rude and obnoxious about it and like I said before they are messy. Having to check a bag isn’t the most annoying part, what is annoying is the fact that they make you run around looking for your bag because they can’t figure out where to put them. On top of that annoyance after a long trip that was made longer by stops is the fact that bathrooms where made for 5 years olds. Even a thin person can’t stand over the toilet properly. Thanks American Airlines for treating people who don’t want your credit card and other add on’s like a herd of cattle.
route: San Diego to LaGuardia via Dallas

author: Christina Creary
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Cuzamel to Dallas. Don’t waste your cash paying for first class. On our way to Cuzamel we weren’t even offered a blanket or food and we checked in with regular flyers, which I totally don’t mind, but why did I pay extra cash if I wouldn’t be priority. Secondly on our flight back our seats were 6a and 6b and by the time they got around to us they had no more food. Totally not acceptable. Thirdly we were guaranteed a stay in premium lounge and upon landing we were told that Cuzamel is unfortunately the only country that was excluded. That took me over the edge. Totally disgusted with the service I received and I will ensure I never fly American Airlines ever again. This service sucks and I hope this company gets shut down. And last but not least the inflight movies did not work.

author: D Marton
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | In flying from Sacramento to Kansas City through Phoenix, (Date: 8/12/18) our flight was delayed by an hour and a half which forced us to miss our connecting flight in Phoenix. We immediately went to speak to an American Airlines representative, who told us that they were likely not going to be able to get us into Kansas City that evening. What they could do is get us into Phoenix, to which they could put us up in a hotel for the night, and we could fly out the next day (the 13th). Seeing this was only realistic option we had we agreed to stay in Phoenix for the night. As we waited on the flight to arrive from its delay, once we got on the plane, the flight was then again delayed, this time due to weather in Phoenix. After about 20 minutes the flight was then cancelled. We got in line to talk with another American Airlines representative to see what we would need to do for a hotel reservation to stay in Sacramento for the night, as we clearly were not getting into Phoenix. We were then told that they were not responsible for hotel accommodations due to inclement weather. Had we known that the flight to Phoenix was going to have weather trouble we would have taken the flight into Charlotte, or we could have looked at another Airline flight. I asked if I could speak to a manager and the representative told me I would need to go online to file a complaint.. The Customer Service Representative wouldn't even sit us together on our flights for the next day. We were assigned separated seats and when we asked if we could sit together, we were told that we would have to pay a premium for upgraded seats (There were multiple open seats at that time, many of which were not first class). All and all we spent about 7 hours in the airport that day We both ended up having to take an additional day of work We had to pay someone to watch our animals for an additional day We had to pay for a hotel in Sacramento We had to pay for dinner, breakfast, and lunch before we got to fly out the next day (8/13) We had to pay for transportation to the hotel from the airport And we had to pay for an additional day of parking in Kansas City On top of all of this. I have had to call and plead my case (three separate calls) to American Airlines "Customer Service" for over two hours on the phone. I have spoken to three different “Customer Service Reps” and 2 different managers. After a week of not hearing from American Airlines I decided to call back. This time I was told that they could not find the complaint that had been filed by Lou and that if I had a formal complaint I would need to file it with the online form (https://www.aa.com/contact/forms?topic=CR#/). This whole ordeal has cost me an insurmountable amount of time and stress at my job to take care of, almost 3 hours I have been on the phone. On top of it all, I had a device (Nintendo switch) that fell out of my laptop bag on the flight home, valued over $400, now lost. I have notified American Airlines of the lost item as well, both in Phoenix and Kansas City, to which both referred me to the online portal to submit for lost items. I will not being flying with American Airlines ever again, and I will be sure that my company, colleagues, and family are informed on how poorly this company treats their customers for when they decide to make future travel arrangements.
route: Sacramento to Kansas City via Phoenix

author: Lacey Jones
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York to Dallas Ft Worth. My flight with another airline was cancelled last minute due to weather; so, I booked a one-way ticket with AA for the following day using the miles I had been saving for years and paid the $75 fee to do so. After waiting on the runway for almost 3 hours, we were told we had to return to the gate to refuel; however, once at the gate, we were finally told that the flight was cancelled and passengers were told to deplane and figure it out with the gate agent. The next flight AA could get me on was the following day at 6pm, so I waited in line for 3 more hours to obtain a travel voucher for one night stay (would you want your wife or daughter sleeping alone in LaGuardia Airport?) But to my surprise, I was told by the AA gate agent, who was seemingly extremely exhausted and overwhelmed, that AA no longer issued travel vouchers and that would have to instead submit a post-flight reimbursement claim at AA.com/customerrelations, including all receipts for hotel, food and transportation. As you can already guess, my request was denied, stating that it is not AA's 'approach to offer compensation for ATC delays', plus a bunch of other highly-pacifist lip service. My frustration and reason for this review is not due to my time being wasted on a runway for 3 hours or even for the flight being cancelled. My frustration is due to the fact that an AA employee lied directly to my face about AA no longer issuing travel vouchers (since apparently they do still offer voucher for cancelled flights) knowing damn-well I would not be reimbursed. So, on top of the miles and fee I paid to use those miles that I'd already spent thousands of dollars on to obtain, I'm out an additional $470 bc their employee lied to me. Had I known this, I would have demanded a voucher or a solution for where to sleep.
route: New York to Dallas Ft Worth

author: M Cooper
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | I was forced to use American Airlines to save $300 on a round-trip ticket from other airlines, so it was cheaper but the employees were all rude with a poor attitude from the very beginning. American Airlines is by far the worst airline I’ve ever flown and I fly at least five times a year for the last 18 years. Their customer service is complete garbage and they treat you like an animal. If they spoke to me out in the street or on the sidewalk like that they wouldn’t walk away with their front teeth intact, but since they work for an airline I have to be polite. Without working for a highly secured airport situation they wouldn’t talk to people the way they do or treat them that way. Will never fly AA again if I can help it. Stick with Southwest, JetBlue, any of the more people oriented and polite fun airlines.

author: D Weare
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Denver. Since moving to Denver over a year ago I have had to travel more than 10 times. Given that American Airlines has a hub in Dallas it offers the most options for flights each day, so until now I have chosen to fly with them. However, as I sit on yet another delayed flight I have decided that this will be my last trip with American. In the 20 legs between Dallas and Denver I have flown with American I have been delayed on 14 of them. Most of these delays were not weather related. American Airlines is by far the worst carrier I have encountered (and that compared to lousy overall industry performance).

author: Eric Smith
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Boston to Bozeman. My wife and I booked a flight from Boston to Montana, and on the flight down we had missed our connecting flight due to the pilot leaving ten minutes early. No big deal, things happen, we understand that. One the flight back, it was delayed repeatedly, being pushed back from 8 pm to 1 am, and then finally canceled. Come to find out the next flight isn't until the following day at 5:30 pm. I spoke to a rep trying to get on an earlier flight, and while he was helpful he was unable to provide any other alternatives. I requested to speak to a supervisor who might be able to pull some strings. Now, up until this point, I was respectful, and while aggravated, attempted as much as possible not to project that aggravation, as I know he was doing his best. I have worked in a call center before, and I know how aggravating it can be to be someones personal punching bag. However, once on the line with this agent, my complaint changed from one of unfortunate circumstance to one of complete disbelief that American Airlines can be so callous towards customers. The supervisor was condescending, patronizing, and insulting from the very opening of the call. She pronounced my name with blatant disgust and ensured to pronounce hers with an air of authority that indicated I should feel graced by the fact that she took a few minutes out of her important schedule to speak to me. She belittled my concerns, refused to offer any recourse whatsoever, or apologies for inconveniences, and basically openly insulted me when I implied that the airline with the flight I was trying to get on was American Airlines, as opposed to being an opposing airlines flight. When I called her out on this by asking her if she found it acceptable to speak to me with a condescending and patronizing tone of voice was to talk over me, loudly telling me that she was not doing that, and then to proceed to disconnect my phone call in the middle of my sentence. I called back, and requested to speak to a supervisor in regards to my experience with a customer service rep. She patched me through to a representative in the same position, that informed me that she doesn't know who she is, and I can't file a complaint through her or speak to anyone who can record a complaint against her, as they are an email only department. After about 15 minutes of going around in circles with her, I wrote out a detailed email to the department I was told to reach out to, and received a cookie cutter type response offering insincere apologies and offering no recourse whatsoever. The agent and my experience with American Airlines has left me in complete disbelief that a company can operate with such indecent practices, and offer no remorse whatsoever or even a token apology to make the situation a little more bearable. I understand that some things, especially weather, are out of a companies control, but the callous disregard they have for the inconvenience that their customers are put through as well as the disrespectful way that their customer service handles the situation are completely unacceptable. There is a lot more to the story that I am unable to add due to the character limit, but I hope that my poor experience will serve to warn people away from this horrible company.

author: W Steiner
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Santa Fe to West Palm Beach via Dallas. Missed connecting flights both westbound and eastbound due to American Airlines mechanical and crew problems. Had to spend a night at airport in one direction, and five hours waiting for another connecting flight in the other direction. The line at American Airlines "customer service" was more than 250 people long at the Dallas airport and the airline refused to compensate for their own horrible service. American passenger assistance sets the customer service bar so low that all the others shine. My experience with American Airlines demonstrates why it is better to stay at home than to travel.
route: Santa Fe to West Palm Beach via Dallas

author: V Sparks
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Medford via Phoenix. Was grounded in Dallas with mechanical issues for 4 hours until we finally got re routed to Seattle instead of going to Phoenix. Get to Phoenix and was told our flight into Medford Oregon was canceled that morning! Wanted us to spend night in airport until 9 am Friday and told no other flights. Finally got on Alaskan flight and had no issues. Come back Sunday make it to Phoenix to board plane and have mechanical issues and get late start and miss connection flight in Dallas. Ridiculous.

author: Kelsie Penny
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | I paid for a normal flight to Memphis from Pittsburg which has a layover in Philadelphia. This flight allows you to bring one bag that fits under your seat as long as it’s the appropriate size which I think is 18”x14”x8” which my bag was 14”x14”x8”. They wouldn’t allow overhead access which is a new rule but it can go under your seat. I applied by this rule. As I’m boarding the plane they told me I had to check my bag and couldn’t board with it. This is absolutely bogus. I had to complain to them to let me bring my bag on. They told me there wasn’t anymore overhead bin room. Great, I get that, but mine fits under the seat as I premeasured my bag. They said they didn’t care, they didn’t have overhead bin access so I had to check my bag. I told them I understand that there isn’t but mine fits under my seat. They then tried to say that it didn’t matter because I had two bags, the second being my purse... since when do purses count? But that could also fit in my bag so i put my purse in my bag. They eventually let me take my bag (which comfortably fit under my seat) but I had to complain to them more than enough times. They made multiple people check their bags for no reason.

author: Craig Havenner
customer_review: Not Verified | Orange County to Washington Dulles. Our flight was redirected to Austin due to storms in Dallas. I get it. Refueled and flew to Dallas after 1.5 hours in Austin. Connecting flight rescheduled 4 times then finally canceled. Have been sitting on the ground now in Dallas for 2 hours “waiting for a gate” - Dallas is an AA hub. Ground logistics here are grossly mismanaged and an absolute disgrace.

author: Justin Hays
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Las Vegas. Horrible customer service. They cancelled our flight and offered us no compensation whatsoever. No meal no hotel stay not even a discounted room rate or flight discount. If you would like to be told to wait in an airport for 14 hours this airline is for you.

author: Deborah Johnson
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Duluth via Minneapolis. There was an issue with a plane leaving from Dallas to Chicago and the delay was going to make me miss my connection which was also the last of the two flights that go into the city. I understand that it’s they deal with a lot of angry people but this time I really needed to make my flight for a work obligation. I received little to no help at the desk & was told to call the 800 number. I am so glad I did! I spoke with Deborah (we had the same name) she went above and beyond any flight line agent I’ve ever had (and I fly frequently) I am beyond impressed! She did not have to try to help me as much as she did and calm me in a stressful situation (on the verge of an anxiety attack to calmly writing this review on the plane). She stayed on the phone working a ton of logistics for almost an hour, she stayed on the phone until I was able to confirm I was good to go for my next two flights! She was so kind and helpful. Very appreciative - even in a delayed flight and other less friendly reps. I still give the highest rating because she made up for it all with! Thank you so much!

author: L Zartul
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Washington to Cincinnati. I fly regularly for business reasons, and among all the airlines, American has consistently had the worst cancellation problems and the worst infrastructure for dealing with them. No hotel--not effort to get creative in rescheduling (through connecting)--long delays in customer service that prevent the fixes I independently create. Just fly Delta.

author: Celeste Dunican
customer_review: Not Verified | Reno to Dallas. Do not fly American Airlines. As a young first time traveler I was unaware of how poor customer service would be. We came from Reno trying to get home to Hartford which requires a connecting fight in Dallas Fort Worth. My younger sister and I got to our first gate no problem where they spent 20 minutes begging people to check luggage causing the line to back up. The plane took off late. We thought it wasn’t a huge deal because we had time between flights. Both flights were booked through American which I thought would make them a little more aware of delays with other planes. Myself and 6 other very kind people missed our connecting flight to Hartford all on the same plane. We landed and sat on the ground for 25-30 minutes “waiting for a gate and crew.” They closed our flight because we got off the plane too late by no fault of our own. They then sent us to customer service where we waited in line for about 40 minutes for them to tell us the only other flight to Hartford was at 7:30 am the next morning where we again would have to get on a connecting flight in Chicago. The people were terribly rude at the desk where they then told us it wasn’t their fault and we would have to cover all our room costs to stay the night in Dallas. Flights are not cheap making this service completely inexcusable. It would be a whole different thing if this was an inexpensive product. My sister and I ended up pooling all our traveling money together to spend $90 to stay in a room over night. I wish I could give them zero stars. To be fair our flight there was not something to complain about, but they have lost my business forever. Not to mention all the other people on my same flight who missed their connecting flights. With this first hand experience I would never recommend American Airlines to anyone who would prefer to not be treated like a piece of luggage themselves. If you want disrespectful, unhelpful, ridiculously rude customer service this is the airline for you.

author: Riyad Naser
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Kansas to Barcelona via Chicago. I had been traveling since June 10th when my plane left from Kansas City at 7:00 pm. The plan was to fly to Chicago and then catch a 9:15pm international flight to Barcelona. Then by 9:30 pm June 11th I would be in Amman, Jordan. However, things did not go as planned when my Kansas flight got diverted from Chicago to Madison, Wisconsin due to a storm. Since then, it has been nothing but a nightmare and dissatisfaction with American airlines. In Madison, I waited in line for over three hours along with other passengers to make travel arrangements and hotel reservations. I was the last person to leave the airport, around 2:30am on June 11. The AA staff then assured me that he made my reservations and had rebooked all of my flights through the rest of my international, arrangement. He printed me the boarding pass to Chicago and also to Paris. He informed me to come back in the morning to check-in my bag and sent me off to a hotel. Well, I was back by 9:30am at the airport to start my journey. I checked in and got my boarding passes to Chicago and to Paris. However, the staff informed me that since they made my connections through Delta, they wouldn’t be able to print the boarding pass from Paris to Jordan and that I would have to do that in Paris when I landed. However, they assured me that all is good and that my bag, has a label to AMM; it will continue to Amman. I took their word and got on a plane to Chicago; landed there and continued to my Paris flight. Seven hours later I landed in Terminal 2A in Paris at 10:05 am, June 12th. My supposed flight to Jordan was going to leave around 3pm. So, I ran to get to terminal 2E. I did get there, but I needed a boarding pass to cross through security. First, I tried the kiosks, but was not successful. I talked to an Air France person who informed me there was something wrong with my booking and that I needed to speak with Air France customer service. Luckily, it was just a few feet away; however, the line was 100 feet long. So, I waited in line for 90 minutes. When I got to the customer service representative, they informed me that my reservation was not done correctly by AA and it was cancelled. They told me that the plane to Jordan was full. The representative also said that I would need to talk to American Airlines to fix their mistake and rebook me on another flight. This meant, I had to run back to terminal 2A. I did run to Terminal 2A to find AA counters closed for the day as their last flight was leaving. Luckily, there was somebody trying to get to the locked office who agreed to try to help. Now it was past 1pm, 3 hours after I arrived and I didn’t know if I would ever leave the airport and join my family who travelled one day before me on Sat. Thinking I will be joining them just a day later. It is now 2 days later and God knows where my bag is now. After about 40 minutes, the AA staff told me that he booked me on two Turkish lines arriving in Amman by 11:55pm. I waited for 4 days in Amman for my bag!

author: V Gurlen
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Palm Beach. This airline has often changed our flight times and seats. What is the point of setting up days off and meetings if the airline cannot stick to the schedule they came up with? What is the point of paying extra for a specific seat if they are going to change your seat? What is the point of only having Wi Fi entertainment if the plane has no electric plugs to keep your device powered for 7 hours? I fly several times per year from Florida to the mid west and west coast. On this particular flight the flight attendant passed my row for snacks and drinks. Flight was delayed for departure and I was hungry. I asked her for a snack when she two rows back, rather then walk back two rows she said she would come back. After landing I asked her why she did not come back and why she passed my row - she said that she got busy and tried to get my attention 5 times. I asked my wife and friend sitting next to me if she tried to get my attention and they said no.

author: B Rannan
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Gate crew was horrible! I flew in from Abeline, TX and connected in Dallas before heading home. My flight in Abeline required a gate valet for my carry on because the plane is super small - 3 seats across and I can’t stand up straight in the cabin. No problem, as they met us at the arriving gate with our bags. Having not removed the valet tag, the gate crew in Dallas wouldn’t let me take it on the plane, even after showing it clearly fit in their sizing frame, and after watching countless other passengers board with even larger bags. I have flown with this carry on bag countless times with no issues, including flights on American. Rather than seeing that the bag fit, they forced me to check it anyways because heaven forbid they be proven wrong. Screw American Air and their horrible, horrible service.

author: H Maldan
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charleston to Charlotte Amalie. Bought nonrefundable tickets for our trip to Saint Thomas. Purchased the 3rd party flight insurance. Resort informed us that they were unable to accommodate us due to Hurricane. Submitted claim to insurance and they declined the reimbursement. The resort being uninhabitable should have fallen under their coverage but they declined. They even told me to cancel my tickets before I could submit the claim. Even if we found a new accommodation, we couldn't as the resort was a gift, we would have to shell out another $1300. Shady business.

author: Marc O’Rourke
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Orlando to Dublin via Philadelphia. Having read many Bad reviews from customers having flown American airlines , I wasn’t looking forward to a 10 hour Dublin to Orlando flight with a return leg to look forward to 12 days later. We were two adults and 5 children between 10 and 15 years old. From check in staff In Dublin, to the flight crew, everything was above average. Many reviews complained about the seats, how uncomfortable they are and their pitch. This seems to be a problem with Boeing as the 4 Airbus planes we flew were comfortable and more than adequate. One issue we had which did leave a bad taste with all of us was the check In attendant in Orlando. We each had 23kg baggage allowance. On average we only had 10 kg each. We asked to check in one of the children’s cabin baggage and were instructed that this would cost a further $100 as 7 albeit light bags had been checked in. We had to retrieve one of the bags to add her toiletries, as they would have been confiscated, necessitating 45 minutes of waiting for the bag to come back. The check in assistant was adimant and very cold in her customer service. It was an unfortunate experience but the other staff were very good.

author: C Lear
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Philadelphia to Dallas Ft Worth. My original flight was from Philly (departure time 6:05am) to (O'Hare departure 8:10am) then to DFW (arrival at 10:36am). First, I got held up in Philadelphia for almost 3 hours because of the weather. Which, it wasn't even raining out yet but they weren't sure about the weather. Ok. Which in return missed my flight from O'Hare to DFW. I arrived in O'Hare 10:45am. I got another flight departure 1:00pm. Ok. Its 12:30, now the flight is delayed till 1:37. Ok. Its 1:15, flight is now delayed till 4:05! So again, it's 2:30 now my flight gets cancelled. Now there's no flights to DFW until tomorrow morning!! Not going to work for me. So now I have to fly to Raleigh-Durham, NC. To DFW arrival time 9:05. Worst airline imaginable! I will never fly American airlines again nor recommend it to anyone. Awful customer service skills also.

author: S Deane
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Puerto Vallarta to Columbus via Dallas. Never again, a total joke. Had literally everyone running back and forth all over Dallas Ft Worth airport. Delayed, delayed, delayed, only thing delayed was their care for customers. Literally everyone in airport dealing with these jokers was seriously aggravated. Let us get all the way through to the gate to discover the plane already left. We will no longer be using your services.
route: Puerto Vallarta to Columbus via Dallas

author: Evelyn Cummings
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | I am very dissapointed in this airline. They have essentially robbed me and my family. We were scheduled to fly in December 12, 2017 to Puerto Rico and had been saving up to go all out with First Class tickets which is an extreme luxury for us. Due to the devestation of Hurricane Maria we cancelled our flight and were told we had a year to reuse our tickets. I tried to make my new reservation on Aug. 10, 2018 and was declined to use my credit because the credit was only valid until year from the date of purchase which was Aug. 7, 2017 and not from the ticketed departure date of Dec. 12, 2017. That is right, I was 3 days late. Needless to say I was very upset and made a formal request begging for a 3 day extension in order to uae my almost $2,100 credit and this is the message I just received 3 days after my request. I'm sorry that you didn't travel with us as planned nor were you able to use the value of your unused tickets within a year. We know that travel doesn't always happen as planned, which is why we give our customers one year from the date the original ticket was issued to begin new travel. We believe that offering a full year to rebook travel provides our customers the flexibility they need to use their flight credit. I'm sorry for any disappointment we might cause by declining your request. Let me assure you that our position does not lessen our regard for you as our customer. It is always our pleasure to serve you, and I hope that we have the opportunity to welcome you aboard again soon. This is the same as stealing!!! I did not lose $300 or $500 it was almost $2,100 of my hard earned money saved up to to have a dream vacation and due to circumstances out of my control (mother nature) I had to cancel my original vacation and was excited to plan it again for this year only to find out I was 3 days too late! I never expected the airline to act so callously and lack such compassion for their clients after a lifetime of supporting them. The airline has significantly destroyed the image and reputation it had with my entire family.

author: T Garten
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | San Francisco to Ithaca via Philadelphia. Awful from start to finish. Cramped over stuffed planes and the whole experience screamed “how can we make the most money regardless of customer quality?”. My flight was canceled in PHL. They will not reach out to you for a refund so I called customer service and spoke to the rudest woman who was about to explode with anger at any moment. As if it was my fault. She was rageful and just terrible at making me feel like a valued customer. Who knows if I’ll actually get the refund for my cancelled flight (since it’s such an inconvenience to AA airlines). Never ever again. Just the worst.
route: San Francisco to Ithaca via Philadelphia

author: Collin Thompson Benaviidez
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Chicago to Denver. My family and I are trying to get home to Colorado. Me, my brother and my sister and our friend have been put on standby four times, the people at this airline are not much help, they have bad attitudes, are lazy, and they didn’t even bother to ask other people to give up their seats or to check the airplane to see if it was full. I am very mad at this airline and right now you have four very unhappy customers. This airline is not worth flying with and i will rate this 1 out of 5 stars.

author: Hailey Rosenberg
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Grand Junction to Houston. Flight from CO to Dallas at 10:35 delayed to 11:15 so we also missed our layover to Houston. Rescheduled to 11:16 from CO to Dallas. So we get on the plane, sit on it for an hour, now we have evacuated the plane due to a mechanical issue. On top of this, it causes us to miss our rescheduled layover which was the last flight to hobby. So the said they can fly us to IAH at 5:45 (which isn't even the airport we were to fly into). American Airlines has the worst customer service I’ve ever seen. I will never fly this airline again.

author: M Harman
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Ft Lauderdale to Fayetteville via Dallas. Terrible customer service. Have to sleep at airport due to mechanical problems, after they forced me to book (and pay for) my only bag. To complain, I have a choice of standing in line with approximately 100 other people waiting to do the same, or call them (quoted hold time 60 minutes - no kidding). I cannot express enough how much I have come to hate this airline over the years. Just when you think they cannot make you dislike them any more - they find new ways to underdeliver without the smile. While rolling eyes. They have classes on weekends on how to sigh, be useless and insulting at the same time while accomplishing nothing. Oh! And the gate changes. Do not forget the last minute never ending gate changes. Then suddenly the person that was just your gate agent 30 seconds ago, where you have been dutifully and patiently standing, will weasel their way out of helping you. Like a game of gate-agent-wack-a-mole. Hate is a gentle word.
route: Ft Lauderdale to Fayetteville via Dallas

author: T Harmasi
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Norfolk to Montreal via Philadelphia. My flight for 8 AM from Norfolk to Montreal was cancelled due to the crew not being available, it was chaotic at the airport. I waited two whole hours in line with Zero customer care or attention. Finally I was told that the only flight would take me to Montreal is in the afternoon and then I would arrive at 11;30 PM. I did not trust the agent and I talked to another agent who re-booked me via PHL at 10:50 AM and departure being at 8:50 PM from PHL meaning my arrival to Montreal would be almost Midnight. While waiting at the airport I called the customer person and she was kind enough to book me at 6:00 pm (so I gained 2 hours by talking to this person.) Then when I arrived to PHL I walked to customer service department and they put me on flight at 3:00 PM. This is the worst airline and the customer support out for Norfolk was disgusting for them to send passengers home saying there was no flight available, it was not true. IF I was able to get on a flight to Montreal later in the afternoon why was this entire booking not done earlier. The airline has the responsibility to train their agents at the ticket counter and to also train them for being compassionate and understanding and to try their hardest to get people home. on a scale of 1 to 10 (being high ), I will give American airline and its agents zero. Horrible experience and it was unnecessarily delayed.

author: Lindsey Marr
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Bradley to Hilton Head via Charlotte. This is the worst flight company I have ever used. Our initial flight was delayed by 3.5 hours. My second flight is, as expected, delayed. My trip time has been doubled. I will never use this airline again and do NOT recommend. I should have drove.
route: Bradley to Hilton Head via Charlotte

author: B Marchan
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Orlando to Charlotte. First off, our plane got canceled the night before while other airlines just delayed until later into the night. Then, we got charged twice for baggage and the employees were rude. Lady said we had to wait until our whole family was with us. When we were together I got in line and she said I had to wait until she let me in line and I said i was here the whole time and my family is here and she kicked my bag out of the way and put someone in front of me. Then we were told to go to another line to get refunded our baggage and when we got there, they told us to call a number. Ridiculous how you can’t get in person customer service and everything is by phone number.

author: Sukhdev Seehra
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York to St Louis. American Airlines is one of the worst airlines I have traveled. Every time they charged Carry on fee of $50.00 at the gate, cancelling flights and called the reason beyond their control. Our flight taxied on runway for 20 minutes before taking off and they cancelled the flight, because plane didn't have enough fuel for the journey. Is this a good reason? We had to stay overnight in NY at our own expense and spend more the $300.00 not including the taxi fare to and from the Hotel. This is not the first time it has happened in our previous trip also. They overbook the flight and then bump-off people because of some silly reason.

author: S Davillon
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Tampa to El Salvador via Miami. American Airlines has the worst service. They cancelled my trip 3 times. They overbooked the next available flight so they asked us all to check in our carry ons. They didn't care about me needing my suitcases to retrieve my medication. They told me they were just not giving it because it would cause too much trouble.
route: Tampa to El Salvador via Miami

author: Joanna Zamudio
customer_review: Not Verified | Mexico City to Charlotte . This was my first time traveling with American Airlines and to be honest, I was very disappointed. My flight duration was approximately 3 hr 30 min to 4 hours. And what did they serve us to eat? Two cookies and a bag of pretzels. No TV & terrible wifi. I’ve always flown on Delta and it is much better. Don’t think l’ll be flying AA anytime soon.

author: Madison Johnson
customer_review: Not Verified | Jacksonville to Phoenix via Dallas Fort Worth. This was the worst flight experience I ever had. Our flight was delayed an hour and a half to Dallas and made us miss our connector. They put us up in a hotel to get us to Phoenix the next morning, but that flight was delayed an hour as well. They also changed the gate on us to a completely different terminal. We had to sit on the plane for half an hour before departing while technical difficulties were fixed. This interfered with our scheduled plans with friends, and we almost missed a wedding in Payson, AZ. We had to cancel our hotel and car reservations and make new ones, and if you are basic economy you don’t even get a snack. I will never be flying American again.
route: Jacksonville to Phoenix via Dallas Fort Worth

author: S Therman
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Baltimore to Tallahassee via Miami. Flight from BWI was for scheduled for 4:55 got delayed until 9. We didn't get to Miami until 1am. When here the airline gave us a hotel and said it was only 15 min away. We get to the shuttle and ask if they go to the hotel American gave us. And he laughed and said it was 35 min away. So we tried to find a shuttle that could take us but the next one came 1 and a half hours later. So we had to sleep in Miami Airport. Which is the biggest garbage can of a airport that I've been to we got here and trash was laying everywhere. Next our flight from Miami to Tallahassee was scheduled for 10:30 but got canceled. So we're waiting again. And fingers crossed the flight will come at 2 but seeing how frequently flights get delayed and canceled I'm extremely doubtful about taking off at 2.

author: T Veenker
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to New Orleans. I fly 2 to 3 times a month. American Airlines is one of the worst airlines to take. If you want bad service, delayed flights and more gate switching at the last second then take this airline. I avoid their airline like the plague. You would think being around as long as they have they would figure it out. Last leg with them was delayed by an hour because they didn’t have enough flight attendants. Really! Get your act together or sellout to an entity that knows what they are doing and by no means do you deserve a main hub at Dallas. You deserve one in Siberia.

author: Dustin Mancini
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | The worst experience I have had while traveling. Especially the customer service at FFW gate d22 in 8/9/18 at 1130 pm. One representative said my delay was crew related and a second one came up to cover it up and wait it was weather related. Other airlines are flying out and in to DFW now. There is not a weather problem there is a crew problem and the airline is lying to the customers.

author: P Keane
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York JFK to Orlando via Charlotte. My experience was by no means good but not bad. The flight to Charlotte left at a ridiculous time of 5am, Tsa screening didn’t open until 4 am (we arrived at 2am). Even worse the ground crew had terrible attitude problems, there was one agent who arrived, checked in 1 passenger then went home. But apart from that, the flight attendants were lovely people who knew great service. The ground crew in Charlotte seemed to be quite pleasant as well.
route: New York JFK to Orlando via Charlotte

author: S Peal
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Houston to Providence via Charlotte. Almost every flight flown with American this year has been an absolute nightmare. Broken food and drink trucks, no AC, delays, delays, delays.... oh and lying about cause - multiple answers just adds to the stress and issues! I rely on my airline to get me where I’m going to keep my job and support my customers - they do not care and are not helpful. Don’t even get me started on not being able to select a decent seat - everything has a charge - but why would I pay extra for less - which is always the case

author: Andrea Everage
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | I booked a trip via American Airlines on July 7th to travel from Gainesville, FL to Boston, MA on Friday, August 3rd. I checked in the day before the flight and woke up at 4am so I could be ready for the 6:27am departure time. I was to go from Gainesville to Miami, FL. I was supposed to depart Miami, FL at 8:34am and arrive in Boston at 11:51am, where my ride would be waiting. I was notified at 5:18am that my flight had been delayed and we would depart at 7:30am, thereby making me miss my connecting flight in Miami. There was no reason given for delay. Then I was notified at 6:22am that the flight was cancelled. No reason given. I was to be rebooked on a flight that would arrive in Boston at 12:47am the following morning. I let the desk agent at Gainesville know this would not work for me. They rebooked my flight from the Orlando airport to Charlotte, NC and the soonest they could get me in would be 5:11pm to Boston. They sent me on a shuttle to the Orlando airport where we were delayed yet again taking off. We were delayed 30 minutes in Charlotte, then sat on the tarmac for 2 hours. It was awful. I ended up arriving into Boston at 8pm. I was tired, upset and had missed my ride. When I tried to get reimbursed for my time and the inconvenience, American Airlines Customer Solutions offered 7500 bonus miles, which is embarrassingly meager and anyway, I wouldn’t fly with them again if they were the last airline available. I was never told why there were so many delays or why my flight was cancelled on August 3rd. American Airlines has awful customer service, lacks the desire to communicate and does not value customer satisfaction. As far as I’m concerned, they took my money and caused me unnecessary stress.

author: E Meacher
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Miami. Sat on tarmac for 45 minutes pilot said "Miami is open 24 hours so we are going to take our time." Flight before this one (the flight I'm reviewing was a connecting flight) was also delayed. Flight attendants kept bumping into my seat as they would pass by. $25 checked bag fee which is really stupid considering their competitors offer 1 if not sometimes two free checked bags.

author: Eric Willianms
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Paris CDG to New York. A bit of an "airline-geek" I used a convenient website to discover that our B767 was 23.7 years old. Traveling International Business, I was hoping that the plane would be retrofitted with modern amenities. Firstly, the Admirals Club at CDG is magnificent - food...liquor, work-space, relaxing areas; this club puts USA clubs to shame! The plane looked old; the bathrooms were atrocious but functioning but, the seats were fantastic. IFE via Samsung tablet was sufficient. First thing I noticed was the myriad of uniforms and attitudes from the 8 flight attendants. Safety is paramount but, service is what can make or break the passenger's perspective. Each FA wore a different uniform, except for the younger staff, who represented the airline with proper etiquette. Tie, no tie, blue shirt, white shirt, grey jersey dress, etc., it was was mix-match that sent an unprofessional message. Sadly the warmth and service suffered from the same issue. The FA in Business Class functioned. There was no extra sense that I was flying in a "Flagship" experience. Nothing was offered other than the typical drink, dinner and snack. No walk-through the cabins to offer additional aperitifs or any other needs or niceties. The much boasted wine-pairing was not even mentioned. The main starters were poor; not every one likes cold salmon and celery/radish salad. Main plate was OK, certainly not what I have experienced on other carriers including Delta and Cathay Pacific! Asking for dessert to be offered a little later after lunch, the FA serving the 14 of us conveniently forgot. I did however get a cold cup of coffee after troubling the FA - and that's what I felt, like I was a trouble. I understand that working with the public can be aggravating and perhaps working conditions within the employee union may effect attitude but, the service and food quality was extremely poor. The most gracious staff member on the flight was the Captain who was so appreciative that we chose AA! We arrived safely but the seven hours in air was mediocre and truly representative of a 3 star airline. Hey American why not try for a 4 or 5 star rating. But, that might take a lot of hard work, an attitude change and perhaps a uniform that all can wear and be proud of.

author: Jeremy Burns
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Chattanooga. My flight was cancelled both ways. We missed a connecting flight in Charlotte even though we arrived 10 minutes before take off. Airline staff would not let us board because they already gave our seats away. Paid for seat upgrade and ended up sitting in back of the plane and not sitting with my family. I spoke to several staff and no one seemed to care. Horrible!

author: ar Rivera
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Philadelphia to Los Angeles. We were boarded on the plane and sat on the plane for an hour and a half before take off because the line was so backed up and this was only for American airline flights as we were leaving there were still 11 planes behind us. After a flight across the US we come to baggage claim to find out more than half of the bags on that flight were placed on another plane that will arrive 2 hours later. I'm writing this review as I'm sitting on the floor of the airport with this extra time. Thanks American airlines for three hours I'll never get back.

author: Grace Erhart
customer_review: Not Verified | I got home 24 hrs later than scheduled and I was darn lucky to get home and lucky that they put me up in a hotel overnight. Many other passengers had spent the night on the floor in Charlotte North Carolina. Two of my flights to get home we’re canceled then the next day I had a ticket with a seat when I went to board many hours later was told they didn’t have a seat only through the intervention of wonderful employees did I even manage to keep my sanity and they did find me a seat on the plane as it was on the ticket - however no explanation was given for all of the canceled flights. Up until the last second I wasn’t sure I could board. I’m afraid to take this airline again as they may not get me to my destination and I can’t be sure that I’ll get home as scheduled. I’ve had much better service from American Airlines in the past I don’t know what’s going on with this carrier.

author: Rhys Jones
customer_review: Not Verified | London to Norfolk via New York. Flight canceled on way to UK (maintenance), flight canceled on return (JFK to ORF). Previously 6 out of my last 10 flights have been canceled and significant delays. They are just shameless and I am now shifting to United Airlines. I don’t think fare paying passengers will be treated with some respect and any level of customer care until the regulatory authorities/Government take action to implement a code of conduct that protects the passengers.
route: London to Norfolk via New York

author: Michael Nichols
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Los Angeles. Late again! Pilot emphasized 3 x during flight how we would arrive 4 minutes ahead of schedule. Once at LAX, sat on plane over 45 minutes making us over 25 minutes late. Pilot had no explanation except that AA plane at our gate couldn’t move due to minor mechanical problem and paperwork. Couldn’t find another gate at LAX. Same old AA incompetence.

author: Peter VegaMaldonado
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Puerto Rico to Miami. Horrible experience today flying with AA. First, I wake up to two voicemails explaining that my flight was delayed and that I may have to stay the night at my layover destination. So I call the number they left me to try and reserve one for same day. I get one same day but that flight was delayed by 3 hrs. Had to reschedule my connecting flight and now my connecting flight is delayed as well. I’m sitting in the airport waiting on my connecting flight as I type this. If AA does nothing for me about this, I will not fly AA again.

author: Kurt Kipfer
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | This flight segment was the absolute worst flight have had the displeasure of in my 54 years. Apparently, there was poor weather in the area/in route to Charlotte, NC where I was supposed to catch a connecting flight to return to Indianapolis, which was my final destination. At HPN, a Jet Blue flight was canceled out of the blue right before AA flight #5180. Jet Blue would not let any passengers board the plane. 10 minutes later, AA began boarding flight 5180 from HPN to Charlotte. We pushed away from the gate on time, the pilot informed us we should be arriving on time to Charlotte. Then everything came to a stop. 2PM. We sat on the plane for a hour. Weather impacting the departure. The pilot informed us that an alternate route was being filed to skirt the bad weather but due to this refiled flight plan, we would need more refueling. 3PM. No one was allowed to exit the plane. I repeat no one was allowed to exit the plane! 330PM. Now, the plane resumes its place in line further back in the pack. We wait. 4PM. The pilot announced that the refiled flight plan has "dropped out of the system". Passengers sigh. Attendants offer water service for the 1st/only time. 500PM. We continue to wait. My seatmate informs me that fed regulations limit max tarmac stagnation at 3 hours. The attendant informs us that the refueling reset the time counter. How convenient? We were not allowed off the plane the whole time on the plane, before/at/after refueling until ~615PM. After deplaning, the flight was still not "canceled". I rebooked for a departure 2 days later on 7/29.

author: R Nilles
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Chattanooga to Washington via Charlotte. My 8:00 pm flight got cancelled on Friday. Rebooked for 5:40 am Saturday and when I woke up at 3:00 am to get ready to head to the airport I had a notification on my phone saying flight got cancelled again and rebooked for later. This has ruined my trip as I have to keep making my personal schedule changes accordingly. This is not the first time this has happened to me. I plan to make this rebooked flight my last AA flight. I am currently on the phone on hold for past 1hr:37 min. Do you want to be in my place? If no, don’t fly AA.

author: T Meaden
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Raleigh Durham to Chicago. Delayed flight 3 times, from 5:57pm to 2am. Staff is unfriendly and short-tempered, with no acknowledgement of the major disruption to many people’s schedules. I understand things happen, but the staff does that represents American Airlines act defensive and disrespectful as opposed to apologetic and as helpful as they can be given the significant disruption in service. The last time I fly with American Airlines - even if I have to connect through another airport I will not fly American Airlines because they can’t take responsibility for not being able to deliver with no regard for the effect it has in their customers

author: Chris Donaldson
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Albuquerque to Miami via Dallas. More than disturbed with the attitude of the AA staff at Albuquerque this morning. Walked up to the check in clerk this morning and was met with some of the worst attitude I have dealt with traveling (and I travel a lot). She spent more time trying to lecture me like a child than trying to get me on my flight, after causing me to miss the flight she finished her lecture with "you and your handicap brother will be lucky to travel together being that your whole trip is now stand by, good luck). So I asked to chat with the supervisor who I guess was at the gate, so we proceeded to the gate, we arrived at the gate still with plenty of time to board the plane that we had already been kicked off because the agent was too lazy to check and rush one bag to the plane. As I arrived at the gate I asked for supervisor and when she appeared I asked are you a manager, her response was "yes I dont have much time what do you want?" Taken back once again by the courteous and helpful nature of the now management I said "would you like to wait to chat with me until you have more time?" She then peered at me with a cold glare and asked me to continue. I explained the attitude I encountered at the front counter she showed no element of caring and proceeded to tell me if I'm not 1.5 hours early there is no guarantee the staff at AA will do their job and get you on the flight. Other passengers were pervy to my conversation and began to share their stories of rude counter staff here today too. As a seasoned traveler I've seen every aspect of good and bad customer service is this is terrible. Many airlines will bend over backwards to get you on you flights knowing that sometimes we (customers) run a little behind and sometimes you (airlines) run behind and the end goal is transported happy customers. The attitude of the AA staff today was more like your late, here is a unnecessary lecture about being early now your screwed good luck. Lots of options of airlines and AA is slipping.

author: M Leason
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas Ft Worth to Missoula. 2 hours and 15 after scheduled departure and leaving the gate for the second time. Left first time 15 min late, sat on tarmac 15 minutes, then decided not enough fuel. Took 45 min to get back to the gate, took another 30min to get person to pump the fuel, took another 30 minutes to leave the gate for the second time. Utter incompetence! Do not book with AA unless you have no other option.

author: B Hill
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Phoenix to Honolulu. The worst trip ever. Every American airlines flight had some type of mechanical issue. 3 times in less than 24 hours causing me to miss my son's birthday.

author: Robert Cooper
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Philadelphia to Orlando. Worst trip in my 50 years of flying experience. Long delay on flight out for weather, not airlines fault. Then over 2.5 hour delay return trip for repair that was theoretically done before pulling from tarmac. Returned, deplaned and sat with few updates or alternatives. Paid over $200 for upgrades and when we asked for my wife and I to sit together, denied. Because we had booked separately and could only upgrade her to first class willing to give up first class no refund to sit together. Didn’t even try to help us, just said can’t be done. Ended up asking person next to me if they wanted first class and let them sit in wife’s spot so we could fly together.

author: D Kepple
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Philadelphia to Manchester. This airline continues to disappoint. Delayed, delayed, delayed. Why is it they can never get anyone out on time. I have airline points but will be giving them up as I will never fly this airline again, even a free flight is not worth this aggravation. Don’t apply for their credit card either as there really are no advantages to having one. No priority boarding, no free upgrades, they just suck!!

author: Makram Besanty
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Mazatlan to Dallas Ft Worth. Horrible service at Mazatlan international airport, they try to charge you for carry on luggage including threatening you that you are not going on the flight and you are going to miss your flight if you do not give them what they ask. This airline should go out of business for the tactic they use to force you to pay for carry on, never again I would use American Airlines.

author: Deborah P Conroy
customer_review: Not Verified | Buffalo to Philadelphia was fine. Not comfortable, but adequate. However, the connecting flight from Philadelphia to BWI was first delayed multiple times, and finally (an hour and a half later) cancelled altogether. According to the boarding desk personal, flights were being cancelled due to "congestion." Connecting flight was supposed to depart at 8:05 am, but due to all flights to BWI by American out of Philadelphia that day, the first available flight out was at 5:55 pm, which meant my afternoon meeting in Washington was impossible. Apparently Philadelphia to Baltimore was not the only flight cancelled out of Philadelphia that day; there were hundreds of people stranded by American that morning. I did manage to get a rental car and DROVE the rest of the way. Submitting for a refund was also fraught with difficulty and in the end, my $190 aborted flight wound up costing me $327 ($190 + $215 car rental + $18 unknown fee charged to my account by American Airlines two days after the flight date - $96 refund) (I have no idea what the $18 is for. It came out of my account without my approval. I'll be following up on that.) Recounting my difficulties with this airline has elicited many, many horror stories from other travelers. They apparently frequently cancel flights, stranding people, with little recompense and no apology. Do not book with American.
route: Buffalo to Baltimore Washington via Philadelphia

author: D Berton
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Tokyo Narita to Los Angeles. First time experience with this airline on an international route. Both flights on time. Aircraft and restrooms clean. Staff was very professional and proactive on both trips. Tons of entertainment. The food won't be giving Emirates a run for its money anytime soon, but sometimes just a hot, simple meal is nice. Wifi goes from good to slow to good - maybe not worth the money. Would certainly choose them again. Is this really the same airline that seems to be getting all of these negative reviews?

author: L Ginnane
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Laguardia to Chicago Ohare. Horrible experience! I will never fly with American Airlines again. They are so strict with the carry-on luggage it’s ridiculous! I travel all the time and use the same carry-on luggage I travel all the time and use the same carry-on luggage for all different airlines - my carry on fit into their luggage sizer snugly and they still made me check it. I saw them do this with several other passengers also. I know my bag fits in the overhead bin with no problem because I travel with the same back all the time! No more American Airlines for me.

author: Marty Doyle
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Shanghai to West Palm Beach via Dallas Ft Worth. As configured and operated by AA, the Boeing 787 is a flying torture chamber. The seats are hard and narrow. The aisles are so tight as to be impassable and potentially unsafe. Service is perfunctory at best. Avoid at all costs! Take a connecting flight, older plane, train, bus, but avoid this aircraft, at least on this airline. The Boeing 787 is a potentially great plane, but by squeezing in seats to squeeze out every nickle of profit, AA has ruined it. For background, I am a former pilot, average size, over 1.5 million miles on AA and I have never hated a flight so much. Oh, and there were only 3 functioning lavs for probably 100 pax, if you could leapfrog over the legs and even heads in the aisle, and this flight was 80% Asian folks so we are not talking the Chicago Bears in terms of pax size!
route: Shanghai to West Palm Beach via Dallas Ft Worth

author: D Meares
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Wichita to Lexington via Chicago. First flight delayed 1 hour 20 min causing me to miss my connection. My second flight had not left yet but they closed boarding as I got to the gate. Leaving me stuck at the airport for 7 hours until next the available flight. The second flight was delayed over 30 min. The first delay caused me to have incur unplanned and unnecessary rental car fees as I missed my ride at my final destination. After seeing all the other flights that were delayed today with American Airlines I will be choosing a different airline from now on, even if costs a little more.

author: S Allen
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York JFK to Baltimore Washington. We booked two flights with them, round trip and both connecting, and both times in separate months, the flights were cancelled due to maintenance. Same airline, same issue, and has interfered with connecting flights. We were supposed to return home in the late morning, it was delayed by an hour, then cancelled when we were supposed to start boarding. What's our comp? $24 in meal vouchers, a taxi to a different airport, and not much else. I will never fly this airline again, and since I have no preference for airlines, that's saying something. What's wrong with your planes that they're always down for maintenance?
route: New York JFK to Baltimore Washington

author: Mike Sands
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | 1st flight delayed while awaiting flight attendants, 6 other attendants already on plane kicking 6 paying customers off. Arrive 10 min before our connection is to leave. Won’t let us on because door is closed, watched plane sit at gate 20+ min more before leaving. Now stuck overnight in Phoenix at a hotel since 2.30 pm with only $60 to feed 5 people including 2 teenage boys and no transportation. Customer service only held our spots on the “new” flight and never actually booked the tickets - had to spend another hour and 3 more phone calls to get that taken care of. Family that booked months ago to ensure seating together because of some flight anxieties is now spread throughout an entire plane for a 6 hr flight. Out thousands of dollars for prepaid items in our destination, not to mention the $5k we paid AA for this terrible experience, and all we get from anyone at AA is we understand, we’re sorry, it happens, but nothing of substance When it comes to making it right. All so they can manipulate an ontime departure rating by closing a door instead of being compassionate towards their consumers and opening a door on a plane that was still sitting there and having baggage still loaded. Amazing how the doors on our original flight weren’t closed on the missing flight attendant.

author: J Daleros
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | My flight was cancelled and we were just told to either get a refund or rebook another flight. All flights to George Bush airport were fully booked that day. So much of an inconvenience since in the first place i booked the very first trip to have adequate time for possible delays. Able to book going to Hobby airport. I just need to be in houston that day. Unfortunately my checked in baggage was delivered to George bush. Not an urgent need but an inconvenience. Toll free number takes 45 min to call you back. Inquired with AA ground crew at the gate who just shrugged their shoulders. They were all in a rush to go coz their gate was about to close. Finally boarded to fly to hobby airport. I could not understand a thing the flight attendant was paging overhead, her words were garbled and carelessly pronounced.

author: S Merson
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | To make a long story short, our American Airlines 9:45 flight schedule turned into a 30+ hour nightmare. The cherry on top was our lost luggage which American Airlines did not even take responsibility for, albeit our bags finally arrived at our hotel with AA's baggage sticker. The customer service was non-existent every step along the way, and when we did reach a customer service rep they could care less despite the cause of the various circumstances were of their making. Even their online complaint site is a joke. Avoid this airline if at all possible.

author: Brittnee Bates
customer_review: Not Verified | When checking in, the website wouldn’t let me continue knowing I have a seat already reserved. The only thing I could do to continue was pay for a preferred seating. After doing that I figured I should have called before but I didn’t. So I called afterwards and they told me they wouldn’t refund it because “it’s policy that it’s non refundable”. The representative was very professional but the supervisors she said she spoke with were awful. I wish I couldn’t talked to them myself. Yes it’s only $14, but they’re always charging for extras and it’s stupid! I told them there was something wrong with the website since it wouldn’t let me continue. They didn’t care. I have flown with American before and hated it. Hopefully my actual flight goes a lot better than the experience I had today.

author: Jim N Nieman
customer_review: Not Verified | Worst customer service ever. They kept delaying the flight, and after four hours of waiting, cancelled the flight and could not offer any other flights. We were flying from Newark to Charlotte. Long lines of waiting to try to get another flight. We were treated like cattle. One recommendation was to drive to Baltimore and take a flight from there. Management was rude and ignored us. Then an hour on hold when I called to get my refund. Never again.

author: B Lane
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | My flight was late leaving causing me to miss my connecting flight that was suppose to land at noon in Kansas City and I’m suppose to arrive back at fort riley by tonight at midnight. The earliest flight they could give me was 8pm leaving philli and arriving in Kansas City at 1045. It’s a two hour drive back to fort riley causing me to be late to signing back onto post. This was already a sad time for me as I flew back home for emergency leave for a funeral and now going back to work I will be late signing back onto post. Which is a very big deal. When I went to customer service in Philadelphia the agent was extremely rude and unprofessional. Telling me there’s absolutely nothing he would do for me unless I magically appeared with orders. I tried to show him my leave paperwork and he said orders or nothing at all.

author: C Steene
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | New York to Columbia via Chicago. This is the worst experience I've ever had flying. American airlines is a nightmare. Cancelled their flight leaving me stranded at the airport and playing redirection games while I sought for assistance. No customer empathy. Even in the dream or nightmare would never fly American airlines again.
route: New york to Columbia via Chicago

author: Marc L Coleman
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Orlando to New York. After reading reviews, I was very surprised how good the flight was. Left on time, good food and good service. Seats were good, only 4 rows of 2. Plane left on time and arrived on time. No issues whatsoever.

author: Susan Myers
customer_review: Not Verified | Chicago to Dayton. Flight took off on time. After 30 minutes of odd flying, pilot announces cabin pressure was not being maintained. Flight was diverted to Chicago. After landing it was announced that the cargo door was not properly closed. They closed the cargo door and maintenance performed pressure check and we boarded the flight again, three hours later. I’ve contacted American Airlines several times to find our how they can miss a cargo door not being sealed prior to take off. The flight crew was blaming the Chicago ground crew. This concerns me regarding safety for future flights. American Airlines has been dismissive and has responded that they simply don’t have that information and there is no one that they can direct me to for answers. Pathetic. Flight attendants were very pleasant, otherwise.

author: H Darvez
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | I had a flight booked with AA on July 23 at 7PM, they kept sending emails with delay notifications till 11 PM to finally cancel the flight. There started the nightmare - per their representatives AA does not have to provide anything because the cancellation reason was weather (something not out of discussion since there was another flight at 9PM and it was not cancelled). Parents traveling with kids, elderly persons on wheelchairs, etc and AA said that they could not provide any food, hotel,taxi. Everybody was re-scheduled on AA flights from July 25 till 29 (6 days after the booked flight) after any questions their representative kept saying his is not us, this is the company and how they want to address this issue.. I ended up buying a ticket on another airline to flight next day. I never could imagine that behavior from AA.

author: Ellena Rawlings
customer_review: Not Verified | Pretty appalling experience. Have never encountered such poor customer service before. Staff were unhelpful, unfriendly and insensitive to those of us onboard that had very tight connect flight times. Completely unorganised disembarking which resulted in myself and my sister missing our connecting flight, despite telling staff our concerns and seeing that we were visible stressed and upset and about potentially not being able to get home, they did not seem to care or want to help us leave the flight a bit before those who had a little bit longer for connecting flights/remaining in Charlotte. I have never experienced this in many years of travelling with various airlines, worst experiment and left myself and my sister more stressed and upset. Will never fly American airline again.

author: G Leventis
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | An early flight from Orlando to MIA. Check in went smoothly. As we had fairly heavy baggage, the check in staff was really helpful to advise us as to what to do to save money and at the same time adhere to airline policies. All worked ok. After a fairly strenuous TSA check went to departures hall and took the shuttle to the gate. Boarding procedure went ok, even though despite of our seat numbers were called last again. Staff were very helpful and courteous at the gate and on board. The cabin was clean. Just a bottle of non-spring water was offered, which we did decline. A fine flight, departing and arriving on time with staff being efficient. Only downturn is the airline's policy on luggage and staff uniforms that look aged.

author: P Merton
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | It all started when Ticketing agent in San Jose could not complete a family checkin for over an hour. Caused us to miss our 8am plane to DFW even though we were at airport 2 hours before departure. Waited for the next plane scheduled to leave at 1:37pm. But they hadn’t handled our ticket change correctly and we weren’t even booked on the flight. Another agent got us on as the last 3 passengers on board. American had previously announced the crew for the next flight was missing and another crew was busing in from San Francisco. Departed 45 mins late with a tight 1 hour connection in DFW. American assured us that all of the connections would be made. Upon arrival, hurried to change terminals and arrived at gate with 5 mins to spare. No one there even though American agents said they would call ahead and tell them we were coming. Put on next flight scheduled for 10:25 departure to Northwest Arkansas. American announces they don’t have a plane for this flight. They announce that a plane is due at 10:36. Now due to depart at 11:00. We’ll see! Incompetent ticketing agent! Missing crew! Missing plane! I think I’ll stick to Southwest and just drive to Tulsa! No thanks American!
route: San Jose to Northwest Arkansas via DFW

author: F Bailey
customer_review: Not Verified | Boarded plane in Detroit Mi on July 23! Pilot said we had to make a stop in Greensboro due to bad weather, so we flew into Greensboro and were there for 2 hours. Pilot said we would refuel and head to Charlotte at 6:57. We were left Greensboro until 7:45, so I missed my connection to Tri Cities airport! The plane wasn't refueled until after 7. When I got to Charlotte, the second flight going to Tri Cities was cancelled. I was given a phone number to call to make another reservation and was told it was tomorrow July 24 at 2:40. I'm sitting here with several other people whose flights were screwed up! I will never fly American airlines again.
route: Detroit to Tri Cities via Charlotte

author: C Cox
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | San Diego to Phoenix. Flight from PHX was two hours late. Then the return flight was also two hours late. The app said “on time” until the very last minute so there was no way to salvage any of the time. On the day of the flight I got a seating change via the app. Changed us to seats in different rows. Tried to call about it, but the automated system said 1.5 hour wait. Turns out the original seat assignments I got were in a non existent row. These people are a bunch of screw ups. It used to be a good airline, but it sure isn’t anymore.

author: Silvia Fannin
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Melbourne Fl to Dayton via Charlotte. Our flight was scheduled at 8:45 and I received an email this morning at 6:00 that it was delayed and we will miss our connection flight. We knew at the airport that this flight has been delayed for the last 5 consecutive days. If I would have known this in advanced I will schedule my flight for a day early. I considered this an abuse of power by the airline.
route: Melbourne Fl to Dayton via Charlotte

author: E Salifo
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Chicago to Los Angeles. The worst customer service ever given! The staff isn’t very polite they’re very curt with you, you ask for a manager or person in charge they won’t get you one they say they’re not available. From a delayed 4hr flight that started in France not allowing enough time for the 4hr layover we originally had in Chicago they rescheduled us on united giving us 90 minute layover which we missed because they made us go get our bags go through TSA and then recheck our bags etc.. they ended up putting us on another flight that was canceled long story short after 36 hrs at Chicago O’Hare trying to get home American Airlines did nothing to help us we called customer service we asked for a person in charge (non available), not until we had to get loud with them that they finally got us on stand by again for like the 7th time that we were able to get on a flight! We spend $300 on a hotel stay that wasn’t planned and to top it off American Airlines sent our luggage with United we had no clothes and our luggage was at LAX!

author: Atef Mikhael
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Syracuse to Cancun via Charlotte. Vacation ruined, 2nd time last year vacation to Jamaica ruined (lost 1 day flight cancelled), this year lost the bag came after 1 day. On our way back flight delayed, 1 more day in transit! Wife flew from JFK to Syracuse last year lost the bag, will never fly AA any more. I do not care about the entertainment, staff kindness, food, wifi, I am talking about basic stuff. Flights for the most part delayed, cancelled etc, bags expectedly messed up, delayed,lost. I cannot remember a trip without issues.

author: M Tarconi
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Minneapolis to Philadelphia. Do not fly this airline! When booking it may seem cheaper but they nickel and dime you for every little thing which cost you more in the long run. My son had a bicycle that could only fit in an oversized bag. When we went to check in they charged us $150 extra because there was a bike inside the bag. Not reading word for word the baggage policy, as most passengers don't, we were unaware bikes were not allowed unless in a box. The manager and the baggage check in person accused us of Fraud and stealing from the airline. We explained it was not stealing No fraud because we were unaware of of the policy. Nonetheless they both continued harassing us and would not make any accommodations even though my wife is a frequent business flyer on their airline. They charged us $150 extra. Never flying this Airline again.

author: L Tanner
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Delayed in Roanoke 2 hours trying to get to Charlotte. Last month I missed my connecting flight as a result of a delayed flight. I will be seeing another airline next time even if I have to get on four planes to get where I am going. I am not getting what I am paying for.

author: H Steade
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Miami to Tampa. bWorst experience of my life flying ever! I fly a ton for work and I have never ever been treated so poorly. My husband and I have the American Airlines card and have access to their lounge which we pay $400 for annually. The treatment from the staff of the Miami airport tonight is outrageous. We will be canceling and never flying with them again. I understand delays are out of their control but we sat on and unconditioned plane for an hour just to then sit at the airport with literally no update on our constantly delayed flight for hours. To say I’m outraged and disappointed is a major understatement. This has ruined our entire vacation. I can’t believe I’m even paying for this flight they call service. Please, never fly American. I know we won’t be ever again.

author: J Heane
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | I’ve had the most horrid experiences with American. I’ve been delayed both flights to North Carolina from Washington and back by at least an hour. I was supposed to get in tonight at 845 and catch my bus to Bellingham from Seattle but they delayed the fight at the last minute didn’t bother to say anything and I had to pay for another full bus ticket to get home. Coming up I was delayed an hour as well. I think mainly their boarding protocols and strict baggage guidelines and I don’t read the times points to there bad satisfaction for me. Planes are nice though but that’s about it. Of all the airlines I’ve flown American has the most delays beyond anything I’ve seen and do not want to travel with them again.

author: S Murphy
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Miami to Laguardia. My flight was scheduled for 8:32pm. When we get on the plane, we were told shortly after that there was going to be a delay, which was understandable due to the weather in NY. Soon later, they made everyone get off of the plane because it was too hot on the plane and the air conditioner wasn’t effective, and they ran out of drinking water. We get off of the plane and wait for an update. No accurate update was given. We were simply told that the weather was bad and that now our Captain can’t fky because he’s over his time. They called several more captains and it was too late for them all to fly. They finally found a captain that Can fly. We get back in the plane, which was crammed. We waited almost an hour. I asked the flight attendant what was going on and what time we were taking off. She said she did not know. I asked for water because it was very hot and was told they ran out still. So we were going to be on a 3 hour flight with no water. Soon later, we all get texts that our flight was cancelled. We asked the flight attendant and they had no information. Finally we were told by the captian that it was cancelled. It was past 12am at this point. It took forever for them to re-in-board the plane. We finally get off and get directed to the reservation area by an AA employee by the name of Ana.Short Spanish looking lady.With no patience, she very rudely screams at us while swinging her finger in our face, to get in a single file line and “don’t even think about cutting”.It’s not like she made that comment before and people ignored her.
