I showed up to the airport in plenty of time only to find out that my flight was delayed after waiting for about an hour after the original take off time I was told the flight was canceled. Employees at the desk said that I could wait for the next flight which flew out the next day or I could rent a rental car and be reimbursed for the cost of the rental car. I decided since time is of the essence and my mom was not doing well that I would Drive eight hours from North Carolina to Alabama to be with her. After driving all night and not getting any sleep I got to Alabama around six in the morning and spent my mothers final hours with her before she passed that evening. When we woke up on Sunday, June 17 my wife could not find my flight record anywhere. After spending an hour and a half on the phone waiting for a customer service rep she got disconnected called back and left a callback number which took over two hours and finally got the flight rebooked. Around 4 PM we got an update from the American airline app saying the flight had once again been canceled my wife got back on the phone and was able to reschedule my flight through Delta putting me home around 2 AM. Now we are trying to get A refund issued on a flight we paid insurance for but have called customer service numerous times tried to use the website to find out how to get a refund and it keeps saying the flight was not canceled but I canceled the flight with the customer service reps at the airport. The amount of hassle and time and money that we have had to spend has been ridiculous especially having to deal with this with the death of my mother. The rental car that I got cost me over $500 with the rental and gas and I’m finding out it’s going to take a long time to get that money refunded. No one should have to wait on the phone for upwards of 5 to 6 hours altogether in the matter of two days and not have any resolution as far as how to cancel flights get refunds or get any help at all. The hoops we have had to jump through just to make sure I made it to my mothers and home when I needed to be had been exhausting and is making an already hard and stressful situation harder. All we are asking for is a refund of the rental car and flight I couldn’t take due to the airline canceling the flight originally but the airline is telling us they will not refund the car because the employee at the airline did not record it, we will only be refunded around $76 for the leg of the flight that was cancelled when the flight cost $484 so half of that should be refunded and are only going to give us a $300 flight voucher when we never fly so we will not use the flight voucher.

author: S Leventis
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Philadelphia to Athens. I have realised that US airlines are in no way near any of the european or other international airlines in terms of in flight service and quality. Especially with American Airlines an airline that I have used time and again, only in order to avoid transit airports, this can be the only choice for a direct flight to Athens from Philly. The Airbus aircraft was perfect and the flight was very good with minor turbulence however somehow I felt unhappy with cabin staff with the exception of a greek speaking steward. Dinner was below average for such a long flight, (10 hours) and so was the miserable "breakfast" just before landing. Hardly did cabin staff ever pass to collect garbage and once when I complained, the guy looked at me as if he wanted to kill me. Courtesy is almost unknown. Likewise the situation in the toilets was beyond any description.

author: Sameer Woddi
customer_review: Not Verified | Cleveland to Charlotte. Customer service was absolutely horrible, arguing with other members in front of customers, didn’t apologize, flight was over booked. Was given a choice. Either get rebooked to a later flight with no forewarning or take your chances and if you can’t get in tough luck? That’s not how business works and I wasn’t accommodated for anything. I’ll never fly American again that’s a fact. Work on your customer service and employee screenings. It's not the customer's job to figure it out if I want take a chance on getting on a flight.

author: S Mannings
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Baltimore to Minneapolis via Charlotte. I was enjoying my first time flying first class until I reached my layover in Charlotte and found my connecting flight to be delayed - as if my layover wasn't already long enough. I try to go to customer service to rebook and the line is way down the terminal. Then I call customer service on the phone but was disconnected because of the high call volume. I look at the departures going to MSP to see an earlier departure that I was willing to pay $70 to jump on, but was denied because I checked baggage in Baltimore. This delay has caused so much inconvenience. You would think AA would take care of their loyalty members. I have another trip booked with them next Monday and I think after that it's to start considering other options.

author: Walter Gutierrez
customer_review: Not Verified | Dallas to Lubbock. For years I have turned a blind eye with the many small problems of the airline: comfortless, no food, delays, and so on. However, my last flight was too much. They cancelled a flight with no reason given (the weather was excellent in all the route). I was told to call a hotel (Motel 6 DFW North) to pick me up for the night, but they never came. Then, I called American Airlines's customer service but the person answering refused to help me with calling the hotel. At the end, I was left the whole night at the airport. By the way, I had purchased insurance and it was not honored. I am just giving two stars because a manager in the morning kindly helped reprogramming my flight.

author: T Barden
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Our flight this evening was delayed 4 times over 3 hours due to bad weather in Chicago. At 9pm we were informed that our flight had been rescheduled for 9:30am the next morning. I understand you can't control the weather, but by this time there were no other flights leaving Raleigh (or the surrounding area) until at least 7am the next morning. I had an important event to attend in Chicago the next morning. When I approached the agent you could tell right away that she didn't care. I tried to find an earlier flight from a nearby area or even just one that got me close to Illinois. I offered to drive from Raleigh part way to catch a flight or even drive from outside Chicago a couple hours...if she could just get me close. The response I received was that my request was too difficult and required too much work on her part. I then asked if there was someone else who could help me and she said I was free to go wait in line again for someone else who might be more willing to spend the time assisting me in getting to my destination. (point to note: there was no one behind me in line) I was frustrated and started to break down into tears (that's how important this event was) but all she did was pick at her nail polish and repeat the phrase 'you will not be making it to Chicago by tomorrow morning.' She then proceeded to tell me that I was not eligible for a hotel voucher because I was not based out of Raleigh? Well played. I travel a decent amount and have a lot of patience for people dealing with travel issues. Travel delays happen and I accommodate, but this time I really needed to get somewhere and American Airlines missed the mark. The least she could have done is shown a little compassion but no, I was treated like I was there to serve her needs as she saw fit. Would it have been so hard for her to ask someone else to help me? Apparently the purchase of a ticket from American Airlines doesn't include basic kindness for the ticket holder. Maybe you have to pay extra for that?

author: E McCarthy
customer_review: Not Verified | I got bumped off a flight last year because they decided to change to a smaller plane. I received a voucher for my 6 hour stay in the Pheonix airport. Fast forward to today and me trying to use said voucher. You have to book 2 weeks in advance and mail the voucher in. A hassle I am sure is used to deter use. My issue is however trying to get through to customer service to book a flight. I have attempted a dozen times today. Twice I have been put on the "we will call you back queue" which said was 8-10 minutes. Both times I have not received a call. Completely worthless. This has been a 4 hour effort so far and I have spoken to no one. After the use of these vouchers I am done with American.

author: J Rucker
customer_review: Not Verified | Columbus to Charlotte. Customer service was horrible. Traveled with my toddler and had little to no help with guidance and questions. All of the workers had very bad attitudes and made my daughter and I very uncomfortable. Never will fly with them again, I thought frontier was bad but I had the worst experience of my life yesterday with American Airlines. and our flight got delayed a couple of times.

author: Katelynn Breneman
customer_review: Not Verified | Baltimore to Boise. Absolutely terrible. First flight was delayed for over an hour so we missed our connecting flight, so we also missed our Grandfathers funeral viewing. Was supposed to go from BWI to Phoenix. Got stuck in Pheonix had to go to Salt Lake City then Boise What should have been 8 hours turned into 16. Then they lost our luggage, and thats just getting to our destination. Trying to get home our plane was delayed once again missed our connecting flight got stuck in Arizona overnight. Didn't offer food or a hotel had to pay out of pocket. Then we have another flight the next morning - canceled. Then we get a flight to Chicago where we found out our new connecting flight we were not booked. Staff at Chicago O'Hare was incredibly rude. Like unbelievably. I want someone to do their job I'm paying you to do it. If they cant do their job find someone who can. I'm not paying thousands of dollars for this poor service. Still in Chicago hope they dont screw up the last flight. But they have not impressed me so far.

author: Raelyn Lancaster
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | American Airlines does not accommodate to their delays and issues. We were scheduled to come home at 7:44am from jackson hole with a layover in Dallas and then land in Austin at 1:38pm needless to say I paid extra money for this flight for the short trip time. We got a notification the night before that our flight would be delayed till 11:30am and we had to switch our connecting flight and us land in Austin after 5pm. It wasn’t even 30 min before flight was supposed to board that they tell us oh no you won’t be departing till 8:20pm! I am pregnant with twins now having to sit in the airport for 8 hours. I went up to the counter to ask if there was any way to get us home sooner that I was pregnant with twins and in need of getting home sooner because have a doctors appointment and the lady was so rude said ma’am I can’t help you go sit down. The people working the counter of American Airlines did not tell us we had to go back out to get our bags then go through the line again to check them we all had to figure that out so when others were saying that’s what we had to do I went to the counter to ask and the man told me “the bags arnt going to check themselves” are you kidding me? Then I over heard how some ladies got food vouchers which we did not. So I had to go to front desk and they sent me on wild goose chase for the vouchers with a whole whopping $24 for two people! After I got the vouchers I had to go back through security once again. This has been the worst experience I have ever had with any airline and I refuse to ever fly with them again and I suggest to anyone taking the time to read this to not fly with them they are the most inconvenient airline ever and do not make adjustments to their delays or issues. I just had signed up to be a AAdvantage member and I cannot cancel that soon enough.

author: E Heinze
customer_review: Not Verified | Took a trip to London and the service on the flight back to DFW was terrible, even though the ride itself and the inflight entertainment were fine. Flight attendants were rude, disinterested, and seemed like they hated being there. As I went to the back of the plane often to stretch my legs, I would hear the flight attendants saying nasty things about passengers. They hardly paid any attention to the passengers except what they were absolutely required to do, spending much of their time gossiping and goofing off in the back. I flew British Airways on the way there and the contrast is astounding. BA is far more professional and courteous to their passengers. Then once in DFW to make a connection, I spoke with two attendants at check-in desks and both were unhelpful and rude. I asked one guy if there was room on an earlier flight and to avoid checking he told me it would cost $100 to change flights (not what I asked). Then I was trying to help a lady who missed her connection, as the plane was still at the gate, and the attendant basically just said “too bad” and didn’t offer to help her get on a different flight or anything even though it was AA’s fault she missed her connection. American Airlines is a terrible airline and if I could avoid flying with them I would.

author: B Santangelo
customer_review: Not Verified | Flew American Airlines from Fargo to Newark via Chicago. Honestly just a terrible airline and rude people too. My bag clearly fit into that “overhead” sign that they keep at every desk and I was still forced to check my bag for a fee of course. Money grubbing rude people who don’t care about their passengers. Would give all zeros if this system let me.

author: Dudley Williams
customer_review: Not Verified | My wife and I on our 26 year anniversary had purchased tickets over year ago sitting next to each other. When we check in advised out seats were not together. Asked the stewardess why she said she would check never came back. This is usual with American Airlines. Back a few years had flight from Vegas that was delayed twice on the tarmac for maintenance reasons. Advised stewardess we had a connecting flight at Charlotte we would be close to missing. She said don't worry we will be first off plane. Well she lied and when I asked her as we were getting off flight she shrugged shoulders and did bit answer. We ran to connecting flight to have the door shut in our face and told we would have to get another flight. We did and 24 hours later finally arrive at Gainesville to having my luggage lost. Once luggage was found my new suitcase (first time use) was shredded. I was offer nothing for the damage. This will be the last time I fly American.

author: Ashley LaPoint
customer_review: Not Verified | Chicago to Orlando. My family will never be using American Airlines again. First off, we get to the airport and everyone has bags that meet the 22x14x9 guidelines, in fact 2 of the 3 bags were under that. We had to pay $25 extra per bag for 2 of them because they were the small wheely bags instead of duffel bags. There was a woman working who was very unhelpful and rude and the other staff was just standing around when the kiosk wasn't working to get our tickets. On my sister's return flight, they charged $50 for her bag and there was ample room for it under the seat. She doesn't even carrying a purse so this was literally all she had. We still have 2 return flights on Tuesday, but I am sure there will be some fiasco since American Airlines seems to hide their fees and guidelines everywhere! I would definitely not recommend this airline.

author: T White
customer_review: Not Verified | New York JFK to Milan. I'll start by saying that the flight itself was smooth. Aside from that, the flying experience with this airline was terrible. Sadly, I had a seat in cattle class for which I paid $60 extra just to reserve with no obvious benefit. American has now crammed 9 seats into what was clearly meant to be an 8 seat row. The seats themselves are significantly narrower and flimsy. To say the seats are uncomfortable is an understatement. And this was a transatlantic flight. The food was barely edible, came with terrible plastic utensils and was basically thrown at us. Service was totally disinterested. Having flown economy class on Lufthansa last year, the whole experience was shocking. Never, never again. American airlines should be ashamed.

author: T Allen
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Never ever again will I fly this company. I fly at least 4 times a year and it was my second time using American Airlines. The first one was a nightmare, well the second was even worse. Now I will pay any money to avoid this company. They delay flights every time without an explanation, service is not friendly, we had an emergency landing and got home 6 (!) hours later than planned. And they don’t even apologize. Absolutely the worst company.

author: Jennifer Varnell
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Horrible experience and no customer service. My daughter flew to go to school oversees on a flight operated by American Airlines. The baggage claim ticket stated AA, but when she arrived at her destination, they would not help even though her luggage was lost on the AA leg of the flight. They would accept no responsibility, instead blaming the last leg of the flight which was with Iberia. Iberia will not respond at all about reimbursing expenses and AA will not offer any assistance. My daughter was in a foreign country without her luggage for 9 days. I called AA 3 times and they could not care less. They do not care about their customers and will do nothing to help you if you have an issue. Worst customer service ever!
route: New York JFK to Florence via Madrid

author: Sumeet Singla
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | They don’t really care about customer relations. I have seen several times that they overbook the flights when seriously, with advent of technology, it can clearly be avoided. They don’t even have enough staff at airports to run things smoothly. Let me tell you what I went through: 1) First my flight from Cedar Rapids to Chicago was delayed by 3 hours. You know how far Chicago is from Cedar Rapids? Just 30 minutes if we go by air. This has happened to me twice. You know airlines from other countries are carrying passengers on their transatlantic flights without delays, cancellations and excellent customer service. Its about time they visit those countries and take a lesson on how to provide a valuable customer service. 2) Then, they let everyone board the plane but somehow manage to find an excuse to not take off. We had to wait for take-off on tarmac for 2 hours and on top of that, the pilot doesn’t even announce periodically what is going on. This was agonizing for so many passengers. I purposely selected this flight because I had a 3 hour layover in Chicago and I was going to meet my friend, but because of delays caused by American Airlines, I will have to wait for another couple of months. Don’t even tell me it was a weather related delay as it was sunny! They clearly either didn’t have pilots or planes to provide the service and yet, booked us knowing very well that their services were not adequate in any way. I reached Chicago Airport at 5.30 pm when I was supposed to arrive there around 2.30 pm. But this was just the beginning. 3) Then while waiting for my next plane out of Chicago to Newark, they very cleverly increased the delay by 15-20 minutes at one time so that customers don’t cancel with them and fly with any other airlines because when you incrementally delay flights by 15 minutes, customers are more likely to stay with that particular airline in order to reach their destination. Whereas, if you had displayed from the beginning that it was 2-3 hours delay, customers were more likely to look for other options to reach their destination. 4) Then we boarded the plane at 8.30 pm, 2.5 hours after scheduled time and the same thing happened. We were on the runway for the next 2.5 hours. 2.5 hours! For what? No one knows. Crew failed to provide any update. There was no weather delays again. After 2.5 hours, the pilot turned the plane back to gate telling that he has completed his hours and couldn’t fly. Tell me about commitment levels displayed by American Airlines. Clearly, there is nothing American about your airlines anymore. 5) Then, I was told bags will arrive at carousel 6 and they arrived at carousel 7 instead. Ground staff in baggage claim area didn’t even have a clue that my flight was cancelled. When I asked about where was my bag, I gave him my bag ticket and he was said “what was texture of your bag, what color was your bag”? What sort of ridiculous questions were they? 7) Now, I had to skip my whole day at work. Horrible!
route: Cedar Rapids to Newark via Chicago

author: Brooke Carmen
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | My sister and I scheduled a flight together and paid extra to claim seats next to each other. Her flight was canceled completely until the next day. We are returning from our trip and her flight and my flight are delayed. Our connecting flight was delayed. Her previous trip was delayed last time she took AA. Don’t take this airline. I went to the desk for help in DFW and the lady didn’t acknowledge my presence. I bought WiFi for $10/an hour and it took 3-5 min per click to download. Never an apology from anyone for the delays.

author: Terry Gilliam
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Jacksonville to New York via Charlotte. Sleeping at CLT: How a flight crew laid waste our $4105.29 AA Vacation family weekend in New York. First, when I wrote my review of our AA Vacations Westin La Paloma trip in April, I didn't think that experience could be worsted (opposite of bested), so I didn't expect to be writing about another superlatively bad AA Vacation again, at least not so soon. I was wrong. The moral of this story is if you value the welfare of your family, your time and your money, don't rely on AA Vacations. But I've gotten ahead of myself. Here's our story. Things went beautifully on the first leg of what was to have been a fun family weekend in NY to celebrate the end of our son's school year. We sped through TSA pre, were greeted courteously at the gate and took our assigned seats in first class on AA1937. After a pleasant short flight to Charlotte, we connected to AA1981 bound for LaGuardia. When that flight didn't push away on time, the captain announced from the flight deck that a "minor technical issue" would hold us up briefly. I followed a running text stream of delay notices from AA on my phone. Then I received the dreaded notice of cancellation. Oddly, the flight crew were still telling us that the “technical issue” was in the process of being fixed. Specifically, the pilot advised that the copilot had flown too many hours to legally make the trip to NY and AA was on the hunt for a replacement. When I told the cabin attendant that the flight had been cancelled, she passed the news to the captain who, nonplussed, announced that "apparently American Airlines notifies passengers of cancellations before telling its crew." We were advised to deplane and come back at 7:00 a.m. the following day. I immediately called AA Vacations who had booked as part of our package non-refundable tickets for activities and events on Saturday. I got a terrific agent named Kristen who nimbly booked us on a flight to Newark. She even kept our first-class status! All we had to do was run the mile from the end of terminal C to the end of terminal B before the flight's scheduled 10:00 departure. We needn't have run. The flight to Newark was delayed due to a mechanical. First 11:00, then 12:00, then vouchers to Starbucks, then 1:00, then first class boarded, then we were told to deplane, then 2:00; and then it was cancelled. The gate agent, a terrific woman with a superman pin affixed to her purse, explained sincerely sympathetically that because NASCAR was in town there were no hotel rooms left in Charlotte. Like Tom Hanks in The Terminal we were to live in the airport for the night. No options. We dragged ourselves back to gate C19, the assigned departure gate for AA9200, boarding at 6:30 a.m. on Saturday. We were heartened to see an airplane already parked there. With nothing to eat, no place to sleep and no cardboard boxes, we were all newly sympathetic to street people. We put as cheerful a face on the five hour night as we could. When boarding time came, we didn't board. The plane that had been sitting at gate C19, on which we had hung the night's hopes was "the wrong size." Yes, the gate agent said he had been given an airplane "the wrong size" for the number of passengers booked. I could feel the crowd of passengers working itself into a mob. Since most like us had been bumped from the CLT/LGA and CLT/EWR flights the night before, I could well sympathize.
route: Jacksonville to New York via Charlotte

author: Angie Wall
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | I purchased tickets Mar. 17 which had us flying out of PDX and arriving in Cozumel the same day. In Sept. 17, I received an email that AA changed our reservations. It seemed fine since it was a shorter travel time than the original tickets. The a.m. of the flight we arrived to check in at PDX, and during the self-check in, we got a priority slip. We took it to the ticket counter and learned that when AA changed our flights, they did not allow their own “mandatory” 50 minutes for the connection flight. As such, they refused to allow us to catch our connection from DFW to CZM. Keep in mind that this was their mandatory layover time and they made the change that didn’t conform to it! AA was unable to locate a flight that would get us into Cozumel the same day, so we were forced to incur an overnight layover at DFW. To add insult to injury, each leg of each flight they were challenged to allow me and my fiancé sit together. We would have to pay at the ticket gate to move seats. Um, we purchased our tickets at the same time, is it too far of a stretch to consider we might want to sit together! So, for four flights we had to take extra time to “sweet talk” the gate agent into letting us sit together. Unbelievable! Due to the layover resulting from AA’s error, we were forced to incur additional hotel and meal costs, spend time rearranging transfers, contacting the hotel, etc., lost an entire day of vacation time/pay, lost our all-inclusive charges and hotel charge from the hotel in Cozumel, stressed out having to pick up the pieces because of AA’s mistake, and now I’m getting the pleasure of fighting with AA since they are only offering is a $250 flight voucher for each of us. That doesn’t come close to compensating for the time, money, and trouble they caused. And actually, at this point, I wish I were fighting with them. They’ve gone incommunicado. Won’t call when they say they will, won’t return calls. and, who would want vouchers from this joke of an airline? The only silver lining was the accommodating flight attendants. Otherwise, this company ought to be ashamed of themselves. Based on my research, this isn’t a one off.
route: Portland to Cozumel via Dallas Fort Worth

author: C Leyton
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | The staff at the gate was by far the worst I have encountered in my life. After making an announcement over the PA system that bags could be checked complementary, I walked up to do so. We had 2 bags that we weren't going to need thru the flight, plus our back packs. She looked us up and proceeded to become incredibly rude and told us that we had to empty our carry ons and try to cram everything into our backpacks and throw away our brand new carry-on luggage, or pay $210 to check them. After making the announcement that they would check them complementary. She was not helpful, made my daughter cry because we had to choose if what personal items to keep or throw away. We're moving cross country and have downsized to the point that it fit into our luggage, and now forced to throw away extremely sentimental items and look like fools and spoken to like preschoolers.

author: K Smith
customer_review: Not Verified | Harrisburg to Philadelphia. This was the worst experience my husband and I have ever had with an airline. There were consistent delays which then caused issues for us to get to our connecting flight in Philadelphia which was the only flight to Athens. We were given incorrect information by the ticketing department on the phone, which then led us to drive the entire way to Philadelphia. We have spent hours trying to figure out a way to be compensated and they have the worst customer service! We will never use American Airlines again and be sure to make our family and friends aware of the issues they have caused us.

author: C Leane
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Don’t fly this airline if you check in bags. A frequent business traveler flying American for many years up until now. 50% of the times I check in bags they are broken into. These are locked and usally broken into in Dallas. Complained for many years got money back for stolen articles but nothing has changed. American can’t seem to fix the problem. This is my last American flight because I can’t depend on their security.
route: Santa Ana to Dallas Ft Worth

author: Carlo Caroli
customer_review: Not Verified | Chicago to Rome. American Airlines, never again to be used on a Transatlantic flight. My partner and I traveled from Chicago to Rome on April 8 and even though I was charged almost $200 more to just be seated together on the only few two seaters available on this flight, it turned out to be the trip from purgatory. The FA kept hitting my shoulder all night long as she was walking back and forth down the aisle. I asked if they had a self service cart with juice/water and snacks in the back galley like most civilized airlines do and the told me it was not the case on this flight. The meal was really average nothing to scream alleluia about. I will truly go out of my way to avoid this company when flying overseas. Why do they call this aircraft the Dreamliner? Perhaps if you travel in First or Business - not so in regular economy. Very disappointed indeed.

author: E Kiser
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Worst flying experience I’ve had. First flight was delayed an hour, and instead of accommodating everyone right there, everyone was promised that they would make their connecting flights. Half the plane didn’t. They were just being lazy and didn’t want to provide customer service. I had to wait until I got to Charlotte to reschedule my flight, because of their delay in Montego Bay. I’m 12th in line on standby and have been waiting at the airport for just the hopes of getting a flight. Here I am 8 hours later, stuck in Charlotte. Waiting for the promise of a standby flight, and if I don’t make it onto this flight, I’m stuck here all night. Customer service was the worst experience of my life, and I’m not being overly dramatic. The manager at Charlotte seemed to just direct people away. He didn’t want to help us, even answer basic questions like “Can you connect us to a manager in denver who could help then?” He was indirect, unhelpful, and unsympathetic to the entire situation. Will never fly this airline again.

author: Dontay Harmon
customer_review: Not Verified | Miami to Denver. Our flight was to leave Miami at 8:25 p.m on a Monday. When we got to our gate at 7:00 p.m we were told to go to another gate halfway across the airport because our gate had be changed. After going to the new location and seating there for about 45 minutes. We were told that our gate had changed back to the gate we were originally at. Finally we get to board the plane around 8:45. The pilot comes over the intercom and says "please take your seats we only have 6 minutes before our crew times out. At this time the fuel truck had just pulled up. After about 10 minutes. The pilot comes back on the intercom and tells us that the crew has times out and that they were not going to be able to fly us to Denver. So the pilots exit the plane. 10 minutes later the flight attendant come on and say "we have a new fight crew on the way and we will be leaving as soon as they get here". 45 minutes to an hour later after sitting on the plane she comes back on only to tell us that there was no new crew and we needed to get off the plane. Now it's around 11:00-11:30. After about an hour of sitting at the gate waiting to hear of any updates. They tell us there's a new fight crew is coming and we would be leaving as soon as they arrived and do there pre-flight checks. So around 12:15 or so the new crew starts to arrive. First 1 pilot, 20 minutes later another pilot, 20 later the engineer comes. I guess. They tell us we will be taking off shortly. Around 1:15 a.m or so. They tell us the the flight attendants have now timed out and our flight would be canceled. It's funny now but not really. They then tell us that we have to go back to the other gate to rebook our flights out. Luckily for us we knew the number to call for rebooking. So we were able to get on the next flight out at 6:45 Tuesday morning. My wife tells me today that they gave her a $100 voucher. Not only did they know they were going to have to cancel the flight but they were dishonest and didn't have to decency to tell us the truth. I have not received anything for them nor do I care to. I will drive to Miami the next time if that's the only way to get there is on American Airlines. They can keep their $100 voucher. If you have any other means of getting to where you need to be I would suggest you use it.

author: Shamar Bowen
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | San Diego to Savannah. American Airlines is by far the worst experience I have ever encountered. My flight has been delayed for approximately 4 hours and I am still waiting. If you have to schedule a flight I recommend not to use this one.
route: San Diego to Savannah via Dallas

author: Peter Pomeranze
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Kona. A surprisingly wonderful experience. It is truly a pleasure to say that everything about this trip was wonderful. They are using an internationally configured aircraft on this seasonal route so the comfort factor was a wow.The attendants were lovely, gracious and efficient in a way that I haven’t experienced with American in a long time. The catering wasn’t great but sufficient and due to the aircraft type wi-fi and entertainment were top notch. Although I know it is not common on American to experience a ride like this so I felt it was important to give credit where it was due.

author: C Gresham
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dayton to Tricities via Charlotte. Horrible layover experience in Charlotte, NC. Incoming Flight delay in Dayton, then they had to change a tire, then we had to wait 15 minutes for a staff member to board. I was okay with the delays but when arrived in Charlotte my connecting flight was delayed too. We arrived 10:47, delayed connector was at 10:50 "I'll never make it". So I asked a floor manager to check if the flight was still there, they said it left, it's was 10:50. Come to find out, it didn't leave until 11:03. I could've made it. Then they stuck me in the economy lodge, filthy, nasty and downgraded my seat on the next days flight. First time laid over overnight.

author: N Christian
customer_review: Not Verified | I wasn’t feeling to well in the middle of the flight and I just wanted to say thank you for the flight attendants on flight 2478 on June 4th from Dallas Ft Worth to Sacramento. They took good care of me. They were very professional and just outright nice. All of them represented their company very well. Thank you.

author: S Heale
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Chicago to Kansas City. I am sitting in Chicago waiting on your flight attendants because of poor planning on American Airlines part. Can we not just leave without them? I do not need a drink. The issue is is that they just don't care how you inconvenience others who have to just willing deal with their obvious ability to plan ahead. It is Chicago - American Airlines have hundreds of flights going in and out can't they have backup flight attendent!!

author: J Lindstrom
customer_review: Not Verified | Philadelphia to Tucson. Absolutely disappointed with trip. First flight was cancelled with only minimal time to reschedule. Rescheduled flight was delayed and captain did horrible job or letting us know and was unsympathetic. No real answers provided except it may be an additional hour stuck on a full flight with a 80% humidity and no air. Completely unprofessional and even de-boarding instructions were less than helpful. You have found a way to lose me not only as a business client but also a personal customer - good job American Airlines.

author: T Meale
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew Economy round trip between Philadelphia to Budapest about a week and a half after American Airlines started this seasonal service. Overall, I was very pleased with the flights. American's 800-number agents were helpful and friendly; the website was easy to navigate for making reservations; transfers between international and domestic American flights at PHL are easy via an airside shuttle bus or a pleasant 15-minute airside walk. Although older, the Boeing 767 worked well for me: I liked the 2-3-2 seating in Economy, legroom was adequate, seats were reasonably padded, the lavatory had just enough room, and with only around 200 passengers, boarding and deplaning were fairly quick. In Economy, there is no individual flight entertainment. Cabin crew on both flights were attentive and amiable. Check-in at BUD was reasonably quick because American had 4 or 5 counter positions open for this one flight at least two and a half hours in advance. In short, American did a good job.

author: Bob Laute
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from Chicago to Philadelphia. Constant delays with this airline all the time. Left O'Hare International 45 minutes late and arrived in Philadelphia 10 minutes late. I thought that was pretty good considering. I see 1 plane parked at terminal A and had been sitting on the tarmac for 33 minutes waiting to pull in. Captain just came on and apologized for the delay and informed us operations had no idea when we will be able to pull into one of the 25 gates that are open.

author: Kurt Miller
customer_review: Not Verified | Dallas to Baton Rouge. It takes a lot for me to go through the effort of placing a review, but American Airlines has worked hard for this one. I travel regularly from Baton Rouge to Dallas Fort Worth and they are consistently late. Not only are they late they will push a scheduled flight so many times at the last minute it eliminates the option of catching an earlier flight that somehow seems to take off before you thought it was scheduled to depart after your original time. Only a true professional at screwing things up to pull this off. I do this for work because it's the most convenient geographical departure and arrival cities, other than that American Airlines is a complete disappointment.

author: Mimi Groom
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | We fly first class mostly between Delta and American Airlines. We are seated right now in American Airlines from SFO to CLT. Our original flight was San Francisco to Dallas with final destination being Ft Myers. Seats generally more comfortable than Delta but no TV, no 110 outlets in our AA flight which means we can’t even watch a movie on our computer for nearly five hour flight. Really? The most annoying thing about American Airlines is they constantly change the time and sometimes the route of the trips. Recently booked RSW to Paris for upcoming September trip and they have already changed the time making it very inconvenient. Our last trip from Vail to RSW had changed with 3 hours of layover in Dallas from 1 hour. I tried to change the time and they said because I had used our miles for that trip, they actually wanted to charge a fee for us to go to economy class (first class was full but we didn’t want all the layover). Again really?
route: San Francisco to Ft Myers via Charlotte

author: Aaron Warren
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | After waiting for 2.5 hours for my flight at my gate D34 flight AA1606 American Airlines failed to notify me of a gate change. No other flights could get me to work on time so I have lost money because they couldn't get me to my destination on time. They also refused to give me accommodation or even at the very least prioritize my boarding so I can get off the plane as soon as possible to make it to work as early as possible. Somehow they managed to blame me for not getting an alert via email, on their app, etc.. American Airlines has the worst customer service that I've ever experienced and will never fly with them again. It's sad to say but even Spirit is better in every way.

author: Tennille Coverly-Pons
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew American Airlines from San Francisco to Grand Cayman via Miami. Worst experience ever! Second time in a row. Thought I would give the benefit of the doubt. Never again! Last flight 3 hours delayed and no food or beverages extra. Absolutely appalling. Will never fly AA again. Will gladly get a more expensive flight
route: San Francisco to Grand Cayman via Miami

author: Jeremy Muller
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Los Angeles to London. I am an Executive Platinum (Emerald) member with American Airlines since 1999, and I have flown 1.5m miles with American Airlines. During my flight from Los Angeles to London Heathrow on Jun 5 (Flight AA108) I requested a cabin crew member to have a family member who was seated in 21A to be relocated to a vacant seat close to me. The cabin crew member was very accommodating and personally relocated my family member, Midway through the flight. The purser of the flight approached me an accused me of having the family member illegally take an unoccupied seat. I tried to explain that I requested the relocation with a cabin crew member and she obliged. The Purser continued to be abusive. I advised her that I will be addressing through all means possible.

author: W Hearne
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Oklahoma City. Normally I don’t have problems with AA but after a recent flight cancellation for the second part of my journey, I am very disappointed with the lack of action on AA’s part. My flight which was on a Sunday night was delayed for about 1.5-2 hours at which point it was canceled due to “maintenance issues.” I called AA to reschedule a flight and also went to the customer service desk. I had a flight for work the following morning at 10:30 so I really need to get back. I asked if I could be put on another flight, switched airlines, flown out somewhere else and come from another place, get a rental car, or anything that would allow me to make my flight the next morning. They said there is nothing I can do but I can go online and get a reimbursement which should be up to $120. I ended up having to rent a car and drive from DFW to OKC which cost me about $260. I have tried to be reimbursed for this cost but the best I got was a $100 voucher that has to be used within a year. The problem is very few flights cost $100 so this forces me to fly AA again within the year and have to pay them more out of my pocket so this is in no way a reimbursement but a way for them to secure my future business. Additionally the refund for my flight was $79. I feel like I did everything I could possibly do on my part to remedy the situation and felt very helpless. I am very disappointed with AA’s effort on this and I will likely turn to other airlines in the future. The next flight I could have flown on was at 4:50 the following night and AA never offered to put me in a hotel so I would have just had to stay in the airport or pay for a hotel anyways. AA created a situation where I was at their mercy for assistance and did nothing.

author: Patrick Murray
customer_review: Not Verified | My entire American Airlines experience was a complete nightmare. I was traveling from Myrtle Beach to Detroit with my wife and 8-month old daughter. Our original flight plan involved a 1-hour layover in DC. After boarding in Myrtle Beach we were instructed there was a weather delay and we were taken off the plane. After waiting 45+ minutes in line at the gate, and being refused help from the neighboring American Airlines gate, we were rebooked for a 1-hour layover in Charlotte. When that flight was also delayed I expressed concern at the gate because we may not make the connector in Charlotte. The employee was disinterested in helping us find a backup plan in case this occurred. When we arrived in Charlotte we had no chance of making the connector. The employee in Myrtle Beach knew full well that we would not make this connector but sent us onto the plane anyway. After waiting 90+ minutes to speak to customer service in Charlotte we were rebooked to travel to Chicago, then to Toledo. We ran through the airport in order to make the flight to Chicago, but later found out that our checked luggage was left in Charlotte. 4 planes in 4 separate airports before we arrived home (with our 8-month old daughter!) at 12:30a. When I filed a formal complaint with the airline we received a token apology.

author: Hannah Shad
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | London to Los Angeles. The worst flight by far. Once everyone was on the plane the pilot announced that we were gonna load on more people who’s flight had been cancelled earlier in the day and that this would make us at least an hour late. Once in air the food was horrendous and inedible and that’s coming from someone who never complains about food. Apart from that the bathroom was extremely untidy with sticky toilet seats. When we landed we were once again waiting and were stuck on the runway for approximately 50 minutes. This all resulted in us being over 2 hours late. If you have another option then choose that one because American is a disgrace. I usually fly with Lufthansa and this was really a downgrade.

author: Angela Fairman
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Pittsburgh to Dallas/Fort Worth. I was so happy and impressed with American Airlines Service. I was traveling from Pittsburgh, PA to Lubbock, Texas. I have never flown before and neither have my children. I have a daughter with special needs and disabilities so I made sure to make all the necessary phone calls to airports, TSA, and American Airlines. I wanted to make sure everything would go smoothly for her and that we wouldn't have any problems with her special needs during flights and her special needs stroller. Even though I made all the calls and had pre-boarding, I wasn't expecting the attention we got. Before each flight, I went to remind the American Airlines Customer service rep of our situation but to my surprise, they were already aware. They even said, "yes, we are all ready for lauren." They knew her name! I was just amazed. No problems with her stroller getting gate checked and when our flight ended, her stroller was in the terminal waiting for us. Even the flight attendance knew her name and gave her special attention. She even got a chance to see the cockpit. I am so incredibly thankful for the great experience that American Airlines gave us for our first ever flight. You made things so much easier and we were all able to enjoy our first plane ride. Thank you so much again and I hope our return home on Saturday is just as great. I will always fly American Airlines!

author: Jamie Tatum
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Miami to Denver. Worst flight experience ever. Was delayed 4 hours due to “weather” although it didn’t look like there was any weather outside. Gate got changed twice which made us walk 20 minutes twice to two different terminals because the gate changes were on opposite ends of the terminal and we weren’t communicated with about why there was a gate change. Once we were at our final gate we continued to wait for our delays to pass and boarded the plane. Once boarded there was an announcement about the flight crew being timed out so they couldn’t fly us and we would have to deplane. We deplaned and waited 2 hours in the gate to get new pilots. Barely any communication about what was going on. Very frustrating and unorganized.

author: A Balaseli
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Boston to San Francisco via Los Angeles. Worst Experience ever and I am very disappointed with the service. American Airlines suppose to set a high standard for all other Airlines. The service agent are rude and not helpful. I definitely will not use this airline again, and l will not recommended it to anyone. We had to sit at the airport overnight.
route: Boston to San Francisco via Los Angeles

author: D Barton
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | I have flown AA approximately ten times all with multiple month gaps and each time I hope they have worked out their issues. To my surprise, a well known, multi-million dollar airline continues to operate as if a group of toddlers was in control. I have been delayed on ALL of my flights on this trip by no less than 45 minutes. Twice out of all of these, the original projected delay wasn’t even long enough and as I type this I have waited an additional 15 minutes past the delay. I have experienced one outstanding flight attendant on these flights, the rest we sub-par. AA has little to no entertainment, rabbit food for snacks (not literally), and worst of all, because it saves the airlines a little money, they book absurd amounts of standby passengers (22 on this flight). AA, get back to treating your customers the way customers should be treated instead of trying to fill your pockets. If I had a choice, I’d never fly this airline again.
route: Salt Lake City to Fort Wayne via Chicago

author: B Radirez
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Santa Fe to Sydney via Dallas, Los Angeles. I purchased a ticket through STA travel more than a month in advance from Sydney to Santa Fe round ticket, including my Advantage Number, which I have had for several years. For some reason, even if for some flights I was located at the back of the aircraft, I was placed in all flights to board on group 8 (the group after the very low priority group, even though I had a 3-leg flight). This was a problem on the way back from Dallas to Los Angeles, when they run out of overhead compartments and tried to make me check my carry on all the way to Sydney (they did not offer valet bag checking). I tried explaining that I had a 6 hours layover in LA and then a very long flight to Sydney, and that I needed my carry on (get very cold on places, and was going to arrive to winter in Sydney), and that I did not understand how the system, knowing that I had a long flight ahead would place me in the last boarding group. After a very unpleasant moment with very unfriendly personnel at the Dallas airport, I was able to bring my carry on in some extra spaces available. Additionally, even I had purchased the ticket earlier, the system would not let me pick seats in one of the flights, so I had to travel in the mid seat, next to the bathroom. They should really try to improve customer service, and respect people paying full ticket fare in advance. For now I will try to avoid American Airlines as much as possible in the future.
route: Santa Fe to Sydney via Dallas, Los Angeles

author: G Rease
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Washington to Kansas City. This is single handedly the worst flight experience I have ever had. Both my round trip flights got canceled due to “weather” (light rain) and forced me and my group to spend the night in other cities and our only reimbursement was rice krispie treats.

author: P Keane
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Portland to Charlotte. Every flight has been delayed by 4 plus hours due to poor planning by the company. There was no communication to us about these delays we had to track an employee down for information. My last flight was overbooked along with other flights in the surrounding gates, all American Airlines. I've never had these problems with any other airline. I will never fly through American Airlines again.

author: J Sapenaro
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | Kansas City to Philadelphia. I had a reservation to travel from MCI to PHL early morning on June 3rd for a business trip. 8 hours before I left for the airport, I got a text message saying that my flight had been canceled and that I'd been rescheduled for June 4th. I called their customer service and was informed that all flights for June 3rd were completely booked. They didn't even explain what happened or why the flight was canceled. What am I supposed to do - not show up fpor my job? I now have to book on another airline very last minute and this is costing the client money.

author: G Morton
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Philadelphia to Orlando. Ground crew 15 minutes late to remove plane from gate. Than it took another 35/40 minutes to cross taxi ways to track take off runway. Would not recommend this airline, or Philadelphia to fly out of.

author: Jordan Twombly Ellis
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | Ithaca to Oklahoma via Philadelphia / DFW. I am sitting on the runway after being delayed. Second time today. American Airlines has without fail delayed every single trip I have ever taken with them. I fly to and from school at least 3 times a year for the past 3 years and not a single one of those 18 trips have I made it where I was going in the time and fashion American said I would. Because of the size of the town I fly from I have no other choice if airline but ANY other airline would be 100 x better than this. For such a large corporation I would expect much better organization and customer service and I am constantly disappointed that this is the standard.
route: Ithaca to Oklahoma via Philadelphia / DFW

author: B Reave
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Philadelphia to Detroit. Front row seats for the sorriest excuse of an airline I've ever witnessed. Staff ignorant and delays are infinite, not to mention the endless walks from one gate to the next in hope of an honest resolve. We're paying 75$ per meal and the airport refuses to show any compassion for its customers.

author: Erin Hicks
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | Seattle to Charlotte is a long flight, would have been nice to have a plane with drop down screens and a movie. I guess they want you to use your own device and if you know to download their app, you can watch one for free. Attendants were pretty good. We arrived in Charlotte and I wished we hadn’t. An absolute disaster of an airport. It’s old, dirty, and the people are rude. The American Airlines gates were all full of people who were angry because of delays, etc. Our flight too was late getting out, we sat on for an hour waiting to take off, serious traffic jam. No bad weather, just way too many flights. Return flight: Daytona to Seattle delayed because of a computer routine maintenance not performed? (per the Captain). A billion dollar company who forgets this? This flight delayed a few hours which caused us to miss connection in Charlotte. New flight meant a 9 hour delay in the awful Charlotte airport. Once we board new flight, we sat for 3 hours because of thunderstorms. American Airlines boarded us knowing this storm was here. A storm doesn’t just show up without warning. So 3 hours on tarmac and then 6 hours for flight. A total of 9 hours we were on this plane. The head flight attendant was a jerk (older male). Didn’t smile not one single time and was very rude to some older folks who got up to use bathroom when seatbelt sign came on because of turbulence. Flight attendants were only at row 10 when they ran out of food you can purchase. And to be offered something to drink only once to folks who have been on a plane 9 hours is just pathetic. Never again American Airlines. You could really tell this company doesn’t care much about the value of your money. They figure people are going to buy airline tickets no matter what so there is no need to earn your business.

author: David Jarrett
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | I don't understand how I can order two tickets and when we get to the airport the seats are separated. This should be common sense and is very frustrating. Why would anyone offer a service like this. Do you even think of the customer. I have never a bad review for any company in my life, but this is such a bad tactic on American Airlines.

author: Marcus Mccoy
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Birmingham. American Airlines cancelled flight at last minute and had me miss funeral and work and had me sitting in airport all day. All they offered me was $50, however when they ask for volunteers to give up seat they offer $500.

author: J Pace
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Cincinnati to Fort Walton Beach. I chose to fly American Airlines because they had a flight leaving about an hour earlier than Delta. Boy was that about the biggest mistake ever. So the actual flying experience wasn’t bad at all. The problem came when my arriving flight into Charlotte, NC to catch a connection was delayed to the gate due to weather. Which was fine, we can’t control the weather. The delay also delayed my connecting flight to Fort Walton Beach. So I was still able to catch my connection. That’s fantastic. Absolutely it was. So I ask the boarding agent if there was a chance that my checked bag wouldn’t get transferred in time to the connecting flight. She said that it’s very possible that it won’t make it in time. So I said that’s ok I’ll work around picking up my bag the next day. And the next day (today) is where the problem started. I show up at 6am and there’s no one at the baggage claim office, no customer service representative to be found. I talked to the ladies at the ticket counter twice and they told me someone be down to help. So I’m there 3 hours before someone opens the door and it takes 2 minutes to get my bag. Why did it take 3 hours? The monitors show when they have flights departing and arriving. There was plenty of time between to accommodate the 2 minutes it took me to get my bag. My biggest complaint is with customer service. Everything else was as good as it could be.

author: Kyla Kendrick
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Newark to New Orleans via Charlotte / Chicago. American Airlines is the worst airline I've ever flown. My 5:00 a.m. flight to Charlotte was delayed a little over an hour, because the AC was broken, after we were told it would take 10-15 min to fix. We then missed our connecting flight from Charlotte to New Orleans and the next one was almost 4 hours later. We had paid extra to have seats next to each other and in preferred seating and when we got off the plane and had to get new boarding passes we were basically told too bad nothing they can do about it. When we arrived to New Orleans everything in my bag was damp and all my clothes had to be put in the dryer. But i had nothing in my bag that could've leaked. On the way back, we had a layover in Chicago of an hour until our connecting flight to Newark. 40 minutes before our flight we found out we're delayed an hour and a half. Im sure 500 other things will go wrong before we even get back to Jersey. First and last time I fly American Airlines.
route: Newark to New Orleans via Charlotte / Chicago

author: Jenny Marie
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | New York to Wichita. After flying once before with American and not having the best experience I decided to give them another shot. On the way here the service was great, 0 delays. Granted that was Memorial Day. Flying home this morning was a pain in the ass. It started arriving to LaGuardia airport this morning with staff who seemed to not be knowledgeable of what they were doing and told me all other flights were booked (not true). My flight was supposed to leave at 1030am from LaGuardia, which turned into 1130am then to 12.50pm mind you I had been sitting st the airport since 8.30am. The only flights left to my final destination was a 10.30pm flight out of DFW meaning I would sit in DFW for 6-7 hours or more depending on delays. Turning a 6 hour travel day into a 17 hour flight day. Additionally I would have missed that flight if I would have not gotten up to go to the restroom and so happen to look at the monitor to see that the gate had changed. No communication what so ever about the gate change. We did not depart to almost 1:15pm - mind you they gave us 0 information about the whereabouts or why our flight was delayed for nearly 2 hours. Finally we made it to Dallas 3.5 hours later. At this point I was tired and irritable. Thank you to the kind woman at DFW working for AA, who got me on a flight sooner than 1030pm, she was patient, kind and emphatic. She made sure I still had my first class seat and all. She turned a very long day into a better one. But after having a experience like this in the past, AA will no longer receive my service nor would I recommend them to anyone.

author: Calley Wipf
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Sioux Falls to Chicago. Our flight was suppose to leave at 6 this morning and we won’t be heading out till 5pm tonight. This is very irritating because we spend a lot of money on our tickets to leave at a certain and were not even leaving anywhere in range to the original time. We received a $24 vouchers for two people for an 11 hour delay. I think that, that is pretty pathetic. We have places to see and things to do and this is a huge waste of my time. I will make sure to tell everyone not to use this airline.

author: Cynthia Eubank
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Dallas to Cleveland. Gate got changed three times at the airport and the staff were very rude to everyone. Then once we board are already delayed flight, we sit on the plane for 30 minutes and still counting for a pilot. No one said anything to us until now. So, we still don’t know when we are going to start off. The smaller seats on this very crowded flight makes it all more fun to sit on a plane forever. Here’s hoping we actually get to move soon. Horrible airline! Not flying them again!

author: L Savanni
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Denver to Chicago, connecting to Helsinki with Finnair from Chicago. If you can, I would recommend not flying with them. There was a delay to our flight and 30 people were supposed to go on a connecting flight to Finland and they didn't hold the flight, then they promised to rebook everyones flights, and now they're saying all flights are booked until another 24+ hours and are not offering paid hotel vouchers or anything. Horrible customer service. very dissapointed.

author: Jenny Urbanski
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Worst experience ever! Going to see my son who is in the Air Force. Flight was delayed overnight. I had the worst help with assistance on changing my flight plans. I was not put up in a hotel, therefore had to pay for two separate hotel rooms as they are non-refundable. Had to change my car rental plans and pay a premium. I was not assisted by a single employee during this situation! I will never fly American Airlines again.
route: Detroit to Dallas Ft Worth via Wichita Falls Texas

author: Dennis Talley
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Phoenix to Roanoke via Charlotte. Avoid the AA local flights out of Charlotte at all costs. Employees are rude and lazy. I will avoid American airlines in the future and cut up the AA credit card. Our money spends the same anywhere and don't need to be treated like these self entitled individuals are actually owed something. If you don't like your job then go somewhere else.

author: D Hochstetter
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | Chicago to Seattle. Our flight was scheduled for 8:10 pm on Wednesday night 5/30, originally but then was delayed 4 different times, 9:00, 10:00, 10:30, and finally was scheduled to depart 11:35 pm. Which I can live with and understand except that my girlfriend and I were sitting in the airport over 5 hours watching other planes takeoff. So we sat patiently for 5 hours and finally began boarding at 11:00 pm. American boarded the entire plane and was ready for take off, but then decided to cancel the flight at 11:47 which was after the rescheduled departure time. Then the earliest flight they could get me was in 24 hrs basically causing me to cancel my entire 3 day trip. Plus they didn't even give out hotel vouchers but instead offered cots to sleep on in the airport! I'm just really disappointed in the deception and lack of customer service/ courtesy. Airlines are allowed to do whatever they want and nothing is ever done about it, that's wrong. Treat customers better that's all we ask!

author: JR Goodrich
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | The Walmart of airlines. Incredibly unremarkable. The International Premium Economy seats are rather nice. The staff seem to care, but it is the details that are desperately lacking, the food which borderlines on institutional, the staff that are nice, but lack passion and enthusiasm, and the paltry amenities that are likes of standard coach of its European rivals. The domestic leg of the journey was reminiscent of Aeroflot of the Soviet days: crammed seating, cabin staff that could not care and food for purchase that is very sub-standard. Come on American, you can do better!
route: Paris CDG to Palm Springs via Dallas Fort Worth

author: Jessica Moyer
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | Extremely disappointed with my experience with American Airlines. In a two week span, I had over 6 flights through American Airlines and every single flight was delayed at least a half hour, one being delayed over an hour and a half due to the pilot being stuck in traffic. Two of my flights were cancelled as well. My flight from Charlotte to Minneapolis was delayed an hour and then boarded for an hour and a half before finally being cancelled. I was put on a flight for 8pm the next day, 24 hours later than my original flight. I was not offered a hotel and was only given a voucher for $12 for a 24 hour delay. Staff in a Chicago was rude and not helpful during my standby flights in my attempt to get to Minneapolis earlier.

author: M Winston
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Punta Cana to Seattle via Miami. Overall the customer service is pretty good with American Airlines. Everyone was friendly to us. My frustration lies with a delay on the ground. It was only announced that the flight would be delayed once we landed because we didn't have a gate, and customs was backed up. We sat waiting for over an hour, returning from an international flight, we still had customs, and another round of security to go through before reaching our connecting flight. We ended up missing our connection, we were rerouted back to the entrance without being told where we were going, when we still had 15min to catch our plane, had they called and had it wait for us, we could have caught it. Instead we were forced to rebook another flight. Communication wasn't great at this point. We thought we were getting rebooked for another route that would get us home only an hour after our original flight, and one flight, as we had originally booked. But we were handed two tickets (rather than the one) on a flight that didn't depart till the next day. They claimed that they don't comp hotels if it's due to weather, the reason for the delay, but no one ever said that we were delayed due to weather. She said I couldn't talk to a manager and wouldn't make eye contact with me after I complained. I would now arrive home a day later, and have to pay $150 more than I originally planned to pay for a cab and hotel. The lady who helped us the next morning was really friendly and didn't charge us to check our bags even though we didn't have receipts for the original payment. She also adjusted our seats so we could sit together. Overall service on the plane was good. Maybe when booking connecting international flights the airlines should require a minimum time in between to eliminate the stress of connecting flights in between. This is not the first time I've had to run from the plane, through customs, and security to catch my connecting flight.
route: Punta Cana to Seattle via Miami

author: S Morton
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | St. George to Atlanta via Phoenix. Booked a first class fare and paid a lot of money to get it. The online system would not allow me to choose a seat assignment. When I arrived, I spoke with the gate agent they gave me a coach seat. There were first class seats available and I had paid for a first class seat! Once boarded there were first class seats available. The crew gave them to American Airlines staff. They made the announcement once everyone was boarded - it was unbelievable! I raised my concern many times. Nobody seemed to care. Hopefully they’ll refund the fare.
route: St. George to Atlanta via Phoenix

author: Katelin Stafford
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | Flight 5749 from Amarillo to Dallas would have been nice, except for the horrible service from a flight attendant. When we boarded there was an entire row of seats open and my significant other and I asked if we could move and sit together. The flight attendant said that we could not because the door had already been closed. Then less than a minute later she allowed a couple that had already been seated together to move to the row. There was still an entire row available. Extremely disappointed with the lack of professionalism and lack of consistency shown by the flight attendant and this staff. Will be choosing other airlines in the future if this is the type of service that American Airlines considers acceptable!

author: H Christie
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charlotte to Chicago. I'm writing this in hopes someone that gets paid too much at American Airlines finally makes some changes to improve how they operate. I was the typical customer making a connection that was predetermined by the airline. Using decades of history and algorithms to maximize efficiency for the company and yet getting customer where they need to be you would think this would not be an issue anymore. We got off one plane and literally ran across the airport getting to our terminal 10 minutes before it was scheduled to leave at which they told us "we knew you were checked in and coming but we can't let you in 10 minutes before flight". At that time we gave them a confused look as it was 10 minutes before the flight. So you see where I am going with this and why I will never fly with them again but the story gets better from there. We go down to customer service as instructed by the gate attendant to see if we can get on the next flight that is 3 hours delay which sounds good at first but not when you have family waiting for you that drove over 4 hours to pick you up. We had asked if they could do anything from free tickets to a cup of coffee of which they denied saying this happens all the time and it is not our fault. And now for the icing on the cake, they were not sure where our luggage was and after 5 minutes they said it made it on to our original flight. Crazy how that works out right? Now after if spins around the turn style for 45 minutes and hopefully nobody takes it they said it will be picked up and then placed in an office for us to pick up. Long story short, we fly often enough that I am 100% confident saying that American Airlines has some major room to improve so please use another even if you pay a few $ more.

author: C Murrell
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Rochester to Boston. This is the third time in a row I have flown with American Airlines and they delayed the departure time by more than 2 hours, not because of the weather but because of “mechanical issues”. Last time it was delayed a total of 5 hours. It is extremely frustrating to be stranded in an airport for such an excessive amount of time because the airline repeatedly has issues with their planes. I realize there are situations that cannot avoided, but for such a lucrative airline I would expect they could afford to have modern planes that don’t require maintenance an hour before departure time. I kept thinking these were random situations that don’t happen too often, but it seems to be American Airlines norm.

author: P Barchas
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Washington to Miami. The plane was very old considering its daily usage (18 years) and not very comfortable. The space for legs was below average and I was quite happy we flew for only 2 hours or so. The flight was delayed because of the weather (which is acceptable) but the provided information was poor and misleading. We had to sit for over 1,5 hour onboard waiting for departure and the only information provided was false, then no further info came along. The flight was bumpy and while landing we had to go-around for a second attempt. The staff was OK, no IFE was present and the service contained standard free non-alcoholic beverage and pretzels only.

author: P Barchas
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Miami to San Francisco. The plane was quite a new one, looked okay to me. The seat size in economy was quite alright for this type of plane. I suppose it is quite a failure if the only free service onboard was non-alcoholic beverages and a mini-bag of pretzels. No meal is provided for a 6-hour flight and the purchase options are very poor and not clear (it differs based on time and route). The in-flight entertainment on the contrary was a surprise - it worked well and the movie selection was quite wide. What I really don't understand is the seating allocation policy of the airline - we used it twice, always used the recommended kiosk self-check in option and in both cases we got a boarding pass with no assigned seats along with a note "please see agent at the gate", which we did and we got the boarding pass from him. I don't see the point of this weird policy and I don't like it.

author: Jackeline Voigt
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | I was very dissatisfied with American Airlines during my last trip. My flight from Colorado Springs to Shreveport was weather delayed in Colorado Springs. I understand that these things happen. But when arriving in Dallas to switch connections to go to Shreveport, I rushed to my gate and found that my plane was still at the gate. But they would not allow me to board. The flight departed earlier than scheduled with me watching it leave the gate without me. I was very disappointed that American did not notify the gate that a passenger was a few minutes late due to their late arrival of a connecting flight. It is not like it was an hour or more, it was 10 minutes at most. Other airlines that I have flown have notified other gates of this happening, especially if it is weather related. I am a frequent flier on many airlines, and it has been done for me before. Due to this, I was under a lot of stress. My main reason for going to Shreveport was to meet my daughter and get her back home to Florida. I went to flight services in Dallas, and they were not any help at all. No monetary help or voucher for a hotel overnight either. They attempted to help me with getting my checked bag that arrived with me in Dallas, but the employee from my arriving gate had already gone home because it was after 9. Because of this, my bag left the next morning to go to Shreveport, even though I was going to be leaving from Dallas later in the day to go back to Florida with my daughter, who was arriving from Shreveport. To make things worse, I had to wait 6 days to get my suitcase returned to me in Florida. After checking with American baggage services, I found out that it stayed in Shreveport for 5 days sitting there. My bag had important business materials inside. Needless to say, unless it is a last resort, I will not be flying American Airlines again. They would not even offer me restitution or a baggage refund for my inconvenience unless I showed receipts of $150.00 or more.
route: Colorado Springs to Shreveport via Dallas

author: L Stanton
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Charleston to Bradley via Philadelphia. Absolute worst experience - flights delayed, missed connection, re-routed, flight delayed 3 more times due to a late crew, then boarded and told after that the pilot was then too tired for the 40 minute flight. We were promised hotel vouchers, food vouchers, etc as we were left in a airport at 10 pm with no where to go and no access to transportation or food given the time of night. The AA reps said to save all food and hotel receipts for reimbursement, in which AA is refusing to cover now. Instead, they offered a $200 voucher to fly in the next year which I refuse to do given my experience, and $120 towards the $340 hotel that was the only option left. They also refused to reimburse for meals and are refusing to escalate the matter as their Executives do not take part of these matters. Way to treat your customers American Airlines! Should have read all the negative reviews before I paid $600 for this flight that left me stranded for an extra 2 days in Philadelphia.

author: R Tasima
customer_review: ✅ Trip Verified | Washington to Los Angeles via Dallas. The staff at the boarding time was very rude and unfriendly. The lady at the gate was very rude to me and my family, we were in Group 9,the lady kept on telling us that don’t you know what Group 9 means and acted not at all polite with me and my family. I understand that there are rules but there is better way of talking to customers and informing them the rules. This was my first time with American Airlines and my start of the trip was very disappointing. A staff cannot be so rude to my family just because we had more than one bag, and the extra bag was a purse and not a bag.
route: Washington to Los Angeles via Dallas

author: Alex Molina
customer_review: ❌ Not Verified | Puerto Vallarta to Tucson. We flew to Puerto Vallarta for our 15th anniversary. The flight there was great. We were saddened to return home from such a beautiful place filled with very nice people. We arrived at the airport early, at 10:00am. When we were trying to process our boarding passes, the woman working at the counter was extremely rude for some reason. Her and her colleague were rolling their eyes and seemed to be annoyed that I was speaking English with my American wife. They made derogatory comments towards my wife being American. She became irate when I was explaining to her that I was a Permanent U.S Resident. I speak fluent Spanish and she ignored me and said she had to call immigration in Phoenix? She left and returned to process my wife's pass. I asked her if I could explain to whomever she was trying to contact my status. I told her that I obviously boarded a plane to get here, and that I needed to get home. I was polite the entire time and she was rude to my wife for no reason. She then said. I can't let you board. No explanation what so ever. My heart sank. I maintain composure and asked her to let me talk to her imaginary friend who she supposedly called at Customs. She just smiled and said Sorry. I asked her to have my Wife board and then I would need a flight rearranged to my native Sonora so I could contact someone at the Consulate. She faked smiled again and said sorry, we can't do anything. She then said I would have to purchase another ticket.
